descriptionX: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.
descriptionY: It absorbs sunlight with the pink areas of its skin, which then shine. This appears to be a form of camouflage.

name: Lumineon
descriptionX: With its shining light, it lures its prey close. However, the light also happens to attract ferocious fish Pokémon—its natural predators.
descriptionY: Lumineon swimming in the darkness of the deep sea look like stars shining in the night sky.

name: Mantyke
descriptionX: Mantyke living in Galar seem to be somewhat sluggish. The colder waters of the seas in this region may be the cause.
descriptionY: It swims along with a school of Remoraid, and they’ll all fight together to repel attackers.

name: Snover
descriptionX: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain’s lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.
descriptionY: Seemingly curious about people, they gather around footsteps they find on snowy mountains.

name: Abomasnow
descriptionX: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.
descriptionY: They appear when the snow flowers bloom. When the petals fall, they retreat to places unknown again.

name: Mega Abomasnow
descriptionX: It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up blizzards. It is also known as “The Ice Monster.”
descriptionY: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.

name: Weavile
descriptionX: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.
descriptionY: They travel in groups of four or five, leaving signs for one another on trees and rocks. They bring down their prey with coordinated attacks.

name: Magnezone
descriptionX: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.
descriptionY: Exposure to a special magnetic field changed Magneton’s molecular structure, turning it into Magnezone.

name: Lickilicky
descriptionX: Lickilicky’s strange tongue can stretch to many times the length of its body. No one has figured out how Lickilicky’s tongue can stretch so far.
descriptionY: Lickilicky can do just about anything with its tongue, which is as dexterous as the human hand. In contrast, Lickilicky’s use of its fingers is clumsy.

name: Rhyperior
descriptionX: It can load up to three projectiles per arm into the holes in its hands. What launches out of those holes could be either rocks or Roggenrola.
descriptionY: It relies on its carapace to deflect incoming attacks and throw its enemy off balance. As soon as that happens, it drives its drill into the foe.

name: Tangrowth
descriptionX: Tangrowth has two arms that it can extend as it pleases. Recent research has shown that these arms are, in fact, bundles of vines.
descriptionY: Vine growth is accelerated for Tangrowth living in warm climates. If the vines grow long, Tangrowth shortens them by tearing parts of them off.

name: Electivire
descriptionX: The amount of electrical energy this Pokémon produces is proportional to the rate of its pulse. The voltage jumps while Electivire is battling.
descriptionY: In terms of electrical-energy output, Electivire is one of the best among all Electric Pokémon. It discharges high-voltage currents from its tails.

name: Magmortar
descriptionX: When Magmortar inhales deeply, the fire burning in its belly intensifies, rising in temperature to over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
descriptionY: Living in the crater of a volcano has caused this Pokémon’s body to resemble its environment— it has an organ similar to a magma chamber.

name: Togekiss
descriptionX: These Pokémon are never seen anywhere near conflict or turmoil. In recent times, they’ve hardly been seen at all.
descriptionY: Known as a bringer of blessings, it’s been depicted on good-luck charms since ancient times.

name: Yanmega
descriptionX: It prefers to battle by biting apart foes’ heads instantly while flying by at high speed.
descriptionY: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

name: Leafeon
descriptionX: When you see Leafeon asleep in a patch of sunshine, you’ll know it is using photosynthesis to produce clean air.
descriptionY: The younger they are, the more they smell like fresh grass. With age, their fragrance takes on the odor of fallen leaves.

name: Glaceon
descriptionX: It can control its body temperature at will. This enables it to freeze the moisture in the atmosphere, creating flurries of diamond dust.
descriptionY: It lowers its body heat to freeze its fur. The hairs then become like needles it can fire.

name: Gliscor
descriptionX: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!
descriptionY: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.

name: Mamoswine
descriptionX: This Pokémon can be spotted in wall paintings from as far back as 10,000 years ago. For a while, it was thought to have gone extinct.
descriptionY: It looks strong, and that’s exactly what it is. As the weather grows colder, its ice tusks grow longer, thicker, and more impressive.

name: Porygon-Z
descriptionX: Porygon-Z had a program installed to allow it to move between dimensions, but the program also caused instability in Porygon-Z’s behavior.
descriptionY: Some say an additional program made this Pokémon evolve, but even academics can’t agree on whether Porygon-Z is really an evolution.

name: Gallade
descriptionX: When trying to protect someone, it extends its elbows as if they were swords and fights savagely.
descriptionY: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.

name: Mega Gallade
descriptionX: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.
descriptionY: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.

name: Probopass
descriptionX: Although it can control its units known as Mini-Noses, they sometimes get lost and don’t come back.
descriptionY: It uses three small units to catch prey and battle enemies. The main body mostly just gives orders.

name: Dusknoir
descriptionX: At the bidding of transmissions from the spirit world, it steals people and Pokémon away. No one knows whether it has a will of its own.
descriptionY: With the mouth on its belly, Dusknoir swallows its target whole. The soul is the only thing eaten—Dusknoir disgorges the body before departing.

name: Froslass
descriptionX: When it finds humans or Pokémon it likes, it freezes them and takes them to its chilly den, where they become decorations.
descriptionY: It freezes prey by blowing its −58 degree Fahrenheit breath. It is said to then secretly display its prey.

name: Rotom
descriptionX: Its electricity-like body can enter some kinds of machines and take control in order to make mischief.
descriptionY: Research continues on this Pokémon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.

name: Heat Rotom
descriptionX: If the convection microwave oven is not working properly, then the Rotom inhabiting it will become lethargic.
descriptionY: This Rotom has possessed a convection microwave oven. It will sear the surrounding area with its burning heat, then smile in delight.

name: Wash Rotom
descriptionX: This Rotom has entered a washing machine. It nods with satisfaction after it floods the surrounding area.
descriptionY: The model of washing machine that Rotom can inspirit has been discontinued, so these appliances are now traded at high prices.

name: Frost Rotom
descriptionX: This Rotom has entered a refrigerator. It leaps around gleefully after it uses cold air to freeze the area around it.
descriptionY: The special motor within the refrigerator is the key to bringing about Rotom’s change in form.

name: Fan Rotom
descriptionX: This Rotom has entered an electric fan. It smirks with satisfaction over a prank well pulled after it blows away everything around it.
descriptionY: There are several appliances that Rotom can inspirit, but the first one to be developed was the electric fan.

name: Mow Rotom
descriptionX: The lawn mower is one of the household appliances that led to the development of the Rotom Dex.
descriptionY: This Rotom has possessed a lawn mower. It will mow down grass and flowers, then swagger around with pride at its accomplishments.

name: Uxie
descriptionX: Known as “The Being of Knowledge.” It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.
descriptionY: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.

name: Mesprit
descriptionX: Known as “The Being of Emotion.” It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.
descriptionY: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake’s surface.

name: Azelf
descriptionX: Known as “The Being of Willpower.” It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.
descriptionY: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf all came from the same egg.

name: Dialga
descriptionX: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.
descriptionY: This Pokémon is spoken of in legend. It is said that time began moving when Dialga was born.

name: Origin Forme Dialga
descriptionX: Radiant light caused Dialga to take on a form bearing a striking resemblance to the creator Pokémon. Dialga now wields such colossal strength that one must conclude this is its true form.
descriptionY: Radiant light caused Dialga to take on a form bearing a striking resemblance to the creator Pokémon. Dialga now wields such colossal strength that one must conclude this is its true form.

name: Palkia
descriptionX: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.
descriptionY: It is said to live in a gap in the spatial dimension parallel to ours. Palkia appears in mythology.

name: Origin Forme Palkia
descriptionX: It soars across the sky in a form that greatly resembles the creator of all things. Perhaps this imitation of appearance is Palkia’s strategy for gaining Arceus’s powers.
descriptionY: It soars across the sky in a form that greatly resembles the creator of all things. Perhaps this imitation of appearance is Palkia’s strategy for gaining Arceus’s powers.

name: Heatran
descriptionX: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.
descriptionY: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.

name: Regigigas
descriptionX: It is said to have made Pokémon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.
descriptionY: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.

name: Altered Forme
descriptionX: This Pokémon is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours, where common knowledge is distorted and strange.
descriptionY: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.

name: Origin Forme
descriptionX: This Pokémon is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours, where common knowledge is distorted and strange.
descriptionY: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.

name: Cresselia
descriptionX: When it flies, it releases shiny particles from its veil-like wings. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
descriptionY: When it flies, it releases shiny particles from its veil-like wings. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

name: Phione
descriptionX: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.
descriptionY: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.

name: Manaphy
descriptionX: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.
descriptionY: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.

name: Darkrai
descriptionX: It chases people and Pokémon from its territory by causing them to experience deep, nightmarish slumbers.
descriptionY: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

name: Land Forme
descriptionX: It can dissolve toxins in the air to instantly transform ruined land into a lush field of flowers.
descriptionY: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

name: Sky Forme
descriptionX: It can dissolve toxins in the air to instantly transform ruined land into a lush field of flowers.
descriptionY: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

name: Arceus
descriptionX: According to the legends of Sinnoh, this Pokémon emerged from an egg and shaped all there is in this world.
descriptionY: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.

name: Victini
descriptionX: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.
descriptionY: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being’s entire body will be overflowing with power.

name: Snivy
descriptionX: Being exposed to sunlight makes its movements swifter. It uses vines more adeptly than its hands.
descriptionY: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

name: Servine
descriptionX: It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.
descriptionY: When it gets dirty, its leaves can’t be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.

name: Serperior
descriptionX: It only gives its all against strong opponents who are not fazed by the glare from Serperior’s noble eyes.
descriptionY: It can stop its opponents’ movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.

name: Tepig
descriptionX: It can deftly dodge its foe’s attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.
descriptionY: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.

name: Pignite
descriptionX: The more it eats, the more fuel it has to make the fire in its stomach stronger. This fills it with even more power.
descriptionY: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

name: Emboar
descriptionX: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.
descriptionY: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.

name: Oshawott
descriptionX: The scalchop on its stomach isn’t just used for battle—it can be used to break open hard berries as well.
descriptionY: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.

name: Dewott
descriptionX: Strict training is how it learns its flowing double-scalchop technique.
descriptionY: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.

name: Samurott
descriptionX: In the time it takes a foe to blink, it can draw and sheathe the seamitars attached to its front legs.
descriptionY: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.

name: Hisuian Samurott
descriptionX: Hard of heart and deft of blade, this rare form of Samurott is a product of the Pokémon’s evolution in the region of Hisui. Its turbulent blows crash into foes like ceaseless pounding waves.
descriptionY: Hard of heart and deft of blade, this rare form of Samurott is a product of the Pokémon’s evolution in the region of Hisui. Its turbulent blows crash into foes like ceaseless pounding waves.

name: Patrat
descriptionX: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watch for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.
descriptionY: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won’t notice a foe coming from behind.

name: Watchog
descriptionX: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.
descriptionY: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.

name: Lillipup
descriptionX: This Pokémon is courageous but also cautious. It uses the soft fur covering its face to collect information about its surroundings.
descriptionY: This Pokémon is far brighter than the average child, and Lillipup won’t forget the love it receives or any abuse it suffers.

name: Herdier
descriptionX: Herdier is a very smart and friendly Pokémon. So much so that there’s a theory that Herdier was the first Pokémon to partner with people.
descriptionY: The black fur that covers this Pokémon’s body is dense and springy. Even sharp fangs bounce right off.

name: Stoutland
descriptionX: These Pokémon seem to enjoy living with humans. Even a Stoutland caught in the wild will warm up to people in about three days.
descriptionY: Stoutland is immensely proud of its impressive moustache. It’s said that moustache length is what determines social standing among this species.

name: Purrloin
descriptionX: It steals things from people just to amuse itself with their frustration. A rivalry exists between this Pokémon and Nickit.
descriptionY: Opponents that get drawn in by its adorable behavior come away with stinging scratches from its claws and stinging pride from its laughter.

name: Liepard
descriptionX: Don’t be fooled by its gorgeous fur and elegant figure. This is a moody and vicious Pokémon.
descriptionY: This stealthy Pokémon sneaks up behind prey without making any sound at all. It competes with Thievul for territory.

name: Pansage
descriptionX: It shares the leaf on its head with weary-looking Pokémon. These leaves are known to relieve stress.
descriptionY: It’s good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It’s kind enough to share them with friends.

name: Simisage
descriptionX: It attacks enemies with strikes of its thorn-covered tail. This Pokémon is wild tempered.
descriptionY: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

name: Pansear
descriptionX: Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.
descriptionY: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Simisear
descriptionX: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.
descriptionY: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

name: Panpour
descriptionX: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. It waters plants with it using its tail.
descriptionY: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

name: Simipour
descriptionX: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.
descriptionY: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.

name: Munna
descriptionX: Late at night, it appears beside people’s pillows. As it feeds on dreams, the patterns on its body give off a faint glow.
descriptionY: It eats dreams and releases mist. The mist is pink when it’s eating a good dream, and black when it’s eating a nightmare.

name: Musharna
descriptionX: When dark mists emanate from its body, don’t get too near. If you do, your nightmares will become reality.
descriptionY: It drowses and dreams all the time. It’s best to leave it be if it’s just woken up, as it’s a terrible grump when freshly roused from sleep.

name: Pidove
descriptionX: Where people go, these Pokémon follow. If you’re scattering food for them, be careful—several hundred of them can gather at once.
descriptionY: It’s forgetful and not very bright, but many Trainers love it anyway for its friendliness and sincerity.

name: Tranquill
descriptionX: It can fly moderately quickly. No matter how far it travels, it can always find its way back to its master and its nest.
descriptionY: These bright Pokémon have acute memories. Apparently delivery workers often choose them as their partners.

name: Male
descriptionX: Unfezant are exceptional fliers. The females are known for their stamina, while the males outclass them in terms of speed.
descriptionY: This Pokémon is intelligent and intensely proud. People will sit up and take notice if you become the Trainer of one.

name: Female
descriptionX: Females of this species are very capable fliers, particularly notable for their stamina. They also take longer to adjust to people.
descriptionY: This Pokémon is intelligent and intensely proud. People will sit up and take notice if you become the Trainer of one.

name: Blitzle
descriptionX: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.
descriptionY: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

name: Zebstrika
descriptionX: When this ill-tempered Pokémon runs wild, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.
descriptionY: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

name: Roggenrola
descriptionX: It’s as hard as steel, but apparently a long soak in water will cause it to soften a bit.
descriptionY: When it detects a noise, it starts to move. The energy core inside it makes this Pokémon slightly warm to the touch.

name: Boldore
descriptionX: If you see its orange crystals start to glow, be wary. It’s about to fire off bursts of energy.
descriptionY: It relies on sound in order to monitor what’s in its vicinity. When angered, it will attack without ever changing the direction it’s facing.

name: Gigalith
descriptionX: This hardy Pokémon can often be found on construction sites and in mines, working alongside people and Copperajah.
descriptionY: Although its energy blasts can blow away a dump truck, they have a limitation—they can only be fired when the sun is out.

name: Woobat
descriptionX: While inside a cave, if you look up and see lots of heart-shaped marks lining the walls, it’s evidence that Woobat live there.
descriptionY: It emits ultrasonic waves as it flutters about, searching for its prey—bug Pokémon.

name: Swoobat
descriptionX: Emitting powerful sound waves tires it out. Afterward, it won’t be able to fly for a little while.
descriptionY: The auspicious shape of this Pokémon’s nose apparently led some regions to consider Swoobat a symbol of good luck.

name: Drilbur
descriptionX: It brings its claws together and whirls around at high speed before rushing toward its prey.
descriptionY: It’s a digger, using its claws to burrow through the ground. It causes damage to vegetable crops, so many farmers have little love for it.

name: Excadrill
descriptionX: It’s not uncommon for tunnels that appear to have formed naturally to actually be a result of Excadrill’s rampant digging.
descriptionY: Known as the Drill King, this Pokémon can tunnel through the terrain at speeds of over 90 mph.

name: Audino
descriptionX: Audino’s sense of hearing is superb. Not even a pebble rolling along over a mile away will escape Audino’s ears.
descriptionY: This Pokémon has a kind heart. By touching with its feelers, Audino can gauge other creatures’ feelings and physical conditions.

name: Mega Audino
descriptionX: Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.
descriptionY: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

name: Timburr
descriptionX: It loves helping out with construction projects. It loves it so much that if rain causes work to halt, it swings its log around and throws a tantrum.
descriptionY: Timburr that have started carrying logs that are about three times their size are nearly ready to evolve.

name: Gurdurr
descriptionX: It shows off its muscles to Machoke and other Gurdurr. If it fails to measure up to the other Pokémon, it lies low for a little while.
descriptionY: Gurdurr excels at demolition—construction is not its forte. In any case, there’s skill in the way this Pokémon wields its metal beam.

name: Conkeldurr
descriptionX: Concrete mixed by Conkeldurr is much more durable than normal concrete, even when the compositions of the two materials are the same.
descriptionY: When going all out, this Pokémon throws aside its concrete pillars and leaps at opponents to pummel them with its fists.

name: Tympole
descriptionX: Graceful ripples running across the water’s surface are a sure sign that Tympole are singing in high-pitched voices below.
descriptionY: It uses sound waves to communicate with others of its kind. People and other Pokémon species can’t hear its cries of warning.

name: Palpitoad
descriptionX: It weakens its prey with sound waves intense enough to cause headaches, then entangles them with its sticky tongue.
descriptionY: On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to the ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.

name: Seismitoad
descriptionX: The vibrating of the bumps all over its body causes earthquake-like tremors. Seismitoad and Croagunk are similar species.
descriptionY: This Pokémon is popular among the elderly, who say the vibrations of its lumps are great for massages.

name: Throh
descriptionX: It performs throwing moves with first-rate skill. Over the course of many battles, Throh’s belt grows darker as it absorbs its wearer’s sweat.
descriptionY: They train in groups of five. Any member that can’t keep up will discard its belt and leave the group.

name: Sawk
descriptionX: If you see a Sawk training in the mountains in its single-minded pursuit of strength, it’s best to quietly pass by.
descriptionY: The karate chops of a Sawk that’s trained itself to the limit can cleave the ocean itself.

name: Sewaddle
descriptionX: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.
descriptionY: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.

name: Swadloon
descriptionX: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.
descriptionY: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.

name: Leavanny
descriptionX: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves by using the sticky silk secreted from its mouth.
descriptionY: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.

name: Venipede
descriptionX: Venipede and Sizzlipede are similar species, but when the two meet, a huge fight ensues.
descriptionY: Its fangs are highly venomous. If this Pokémon finds prey it thinks it can eat, it leaps for them without any thought of how things might turn out.

name: Whirlipede
descriptionX: This Pokémon spins itself rapidly and charges into its opponents. Its top speed is just over 60 mph.
descriptionY: Whirlipede protects itself with a sturdy shell and poisonous spikes while it stores up the energy it’ll need for evolution.

name: Scolipede
descriptionX: Scolipede latches on to its prey with the claws on its neck before slamming them into the ground and jabbing them with its claws’ toxic spikes.
descriptionY: Scolipede engage in fierce territorial battles with Centiskorch. At the end of one of these battles, the victor makes a meal of the loser.

name: Cottonee
descriptionX: It shoots cotton from its body to protect itself. If it gets caught up in hurricane-strength winds, it can get sent to the other side of the Earth.
descriptionY: Weaving together the cotton of both Cottonee and Eldegoss produces exquisite cloth that’s highly prized by many luxury brands.

name: Whimsicott
descriptionX: It scatters cotton all over the place as a prank. If it gets wet, it’ll become too heavy to move and have no choice but to answer for its mischief.
descriptionY: As long as this Pokémon bathes in sunlight, its cotton keeps growing. If too much cotton fluff builds up, Whimsicott tears it off and scatters it.

name: Petilil
descriptionX: The leaves on its head grow right back even if they fall out. These bitter leaves refresh those who eat them.
descriptionY: If the leaves on its head are pruned with regularity, this Pokémon can be grown into a fine plump shape.

name: Lilligant
descriptionX: The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect, but taking care of it is very difficult.
descriptionY: No matter how much time and money is spent raising it, its flowers are the most beautiful when they bloom in the wild.

name: Hisuian Lilligant
descriptionX: I suspect that its well-developed legs are the result of a life spent on mountains covered in deep snow. The scent it exudes from its flower crown heartens those in proximity.
descriptionY: I suspect that its well-developed legs are the result of a life spent on mountains covered in deep snow. The scent it exudes from its flower crown heartens those in proximity.

name: Red-Striped Form Basculin
descriptionX: Its temperament is vicious and aggressive. This Pokémon is also full of vitality and can multiply rapidly before anyone notices.
descriptionY: It’s so vicious that it’s called the Thug of the River. Yet Basculin is still targeted by predators, such as Dondozo and Bombirdier.

name: Blue-Striped Form Basculin
descriptionX: These Pokémon form schools with others of the same color. The greatest foe of a school of blue Basculin is a school of red Basculin.
descriptionY: The power of its jaws is immense—enough to leave teeth marks in iron sheets. Its personality is also extremely vicious.

name: White-Striped Form Basculin
descriptionX: Though it differs from other Basculin in several respects, including demeanor—this one is gentle—I have categorized it as a regional form given the vast array of shared qualities.
descriptionY: Though it differs from other Basculin in several respects, including demeanor—this one is gentle—I have categorized it as a regional form given the vast array of shared qualities.

name: Sandile
descriptionX: It submerges itself in sand and moves as if swimming. This wise behavior keeps its enemies from finding it and maintains its temperature.
descriptionY: They live hidden under hot desert sands in order to keep their body temperature from dropping.

name: Krokorok
descriptionX: Protected by thin membranes, their eyes can see even in the dead of night. They live in groups of a few individuals.
descriptionY: Thanks to the special membrane covering its eyes, it can see its surroundings clearly, even in the middle of the night.

name: Krookodile
descriptionX: After clamping down with its powerful jaws, it twists its body around to rip its prey in half.
descriptionY: Its unique faculty of sight can detect small prey more than 30 miles away, even in the midst of a sandstorm.

name: Darumaka
descriptionX: Darumaka’s droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.
descriptionY: When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Galarian Darumaka
descriptionX: It lived in snowy areas for so long that its fire sac cooled off and atrophied. It now has an organ that generates cold instead.
descriptionY: The colder they get, the more energetic they are. They freeze their breath to make snowballs, using them as ammo for playful snowball fights.

name: Darmanitan (Standard Mode)
descriptionX: When one is injured in a fierce battle, it hardens into a stone-like form. Then it meditates and sharpens its mind.
descriptionY: Its internal fire burns at 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.

name: Galarian Darmanitan (Standard Mode)
descriptionX: On days when blizzards blow through, it comes down to where people live. It stashes food in the snowball on its head, taking it home for later.
descriptionY: Though it has a gentle disposition, it’s also very strong. It will quickly freeze the snowball on its head before going for a headbutt.

name: Maractus
descriptionX: With noises that could be mistaken for the rattles of maracas, it creates an upbeat rhythm, startling bird Pokémon and making them fly off in a hurry.
descriptionY: Once each year, this Pokémon scatters its seeds. They’re jam-packed with nutrients, making them a precious food source out in the desert.

name: Dwebble
descriptionX: When it finds a stone appealing, it creates a hole inside it and uses it as its home. This Pokémon is the natural enemy of Roggenrola and Rolycoly.
descriptionY: It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there are no suitable rocks to be found, Dwebble may move in to the ports of a Hippowdon.

name: Crustle
descriptionX: This highly territorial Pokémon prefers dry climates. It won’t come out of its boulder on rainy days.
descriptionY: Its thick claws are its greatest weapons. They’re mighty enough to crack Rhyperior’s carapace.

name: Scraggy
descriptionX: If it locks eyes with you, watch out! Nothing and no one is safe from the reckless headbutts of this troublesome Pokémon.
descriptionY: It protects itself with its durable skin. It’s thought that this Pokémon will evolve once its skin has completely stretched out.

name: Scrafty
descriptionX: As halfhearted as this Pokémon’s kicks may seem, they pack enough power to shatter Conkeldurr’s concrete pillars.
descriptionY: While mostly known for having the temperament of an aggressive ruffian, this Pokémon takes very good care of its family, friends, and territory.

name: Sigilyph
descriptionX: Psychic power allows these Pokémon to fly. Some say they were the guardians of an ancient city. Others say they were the guardians’ emissaries.
descriptionY: A discovery was made in the desert where Sigilyph fly. The ruins of what may have been an ancient city were found beneath the sands.

name: Yamask
descriptionX: It wanders through ruins by night, carrying a mask that’s said to have been the face it had when it was still human.
descriptionY: The spirit of a person from a bygone age became this Pokémon. It rambles through ruins, searching for someone who knows its face.

name: Galarian Yamask
descriptionX: A clay slab with cursed engravings took possession of a Yamask. The slab is said to be absorbing the Yamask’s dark power.
descriptionY: It’s said that this Pokémon was formed when an ancient clay tablet was drawn to a vengeful spirit.

name: Cofagrigus
descriptionX: This Pokémon has a body of sparkling gold. People say it no longer remembers that it was once human.
descriptionY: There are many depictions of Cofagrigus decorating ancient tombs. They’re symbols of the wealth that kings of bygone eras had.

name: Tirtouga
descriptionX: This Pokémon inhabited ancient seas. Although it can only crawl, it still comes up onto land in search of prey.
descriptionY: Tirtouga is considered to be the ancestor of many turtle Pokémon. It was restored to life from a fossil.

name: Carracosta
descriptionX: Carracosta completely devours its prey—bones, shells, and all. Because of this, Carracosta’s own shell grows thick and sturdy.
descriptionY: This Pokémon emerges from the water in search of prey despite the fact that it moves more slowly on land.

name: Archen
descriptionX: This Pokémon was successfully restored from a fossil. As research suggested, Archen is unable to fly. But it’s very good at jumping.
descriptionY: Archen is said to be the ancestor of bird Pokémon. It lived in treetops, eating berries and bug Pokémon.

name: Archeops
descriptionX: It needs a running start to take off. If Archeops wants to fly, it first needs to run nearly 25 mph, building speed over a course of about 2.5 miles.
descriptionY: Though capable of flight, Archeops was apparently better at hunting on the ground.

name: Trubbish
descriptionX: Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you leave trash lying around, you could even find one of these Pokémon living in your room.
descriptionY: This Pokémon was born from a bag stuffed with trash. Galarian Weezing relish the fumes belched by Trubbish.

name: Garbodor
descriptionX: This Pokémon eats trash, which turns into poison inside its body. The main component of the poison depends on what sort of trash was eaten.
descriptionY: The toxic liquid it launches from its right arm is so virulent that it can kill a weakened creature instantly.

name: Gigantamax Garbodor
descriptionX: Due to Gigantamax energy, this Pokémon’s toxic gas has become much thicker, congealing into masses shaped like discarded toys.
descriptionY: It sprays toxic gas from its mouth and fingers. If the gas engulfs you, the toxins will seep in all the way down to your bones.

name: Zorua
descriptionX: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.
descriptionY: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.

name: Hisuian Zorua
descriptionX: A once-departed soul, returned to life in Hisui. Derives power from resentment, which rises as energy atop its head and takes on the forms of foes. In this way, Zorua vents lingering malice.
descriptionY: A once-departed soul, returned to life in Hisui. Derives power from resentment, which rises as energy atop its head and takes on the forms of foes. In this way, Zorua vents lingering malice.

name: Zoroark
descriptionX: Stories say those who tried to catch Zoroark were trapped in an illusion and punished.
descriptionY: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.

name: Hisuian Zoroark
descriptionX: With its disheveled white fur, it looks like an embodiment of death. Heedless of its own safety, Zoroark attacks its nemeses with a bitter energy so intense, it lacerates Zoroark’s own body.
descriptionY: With its disheveled white fur, it looks like an embodiment of death. Heedless of its own safety, Zoroark attacks its nemeses with a bitter energy so intense, it lacerates Zoroark’s own body.

name: Minccino
descriptionX: The way it brushes away grime with its tail can be helpful when cleaning. But its focus on spotlessness can make cleaning more of a hassle.
descriptionY: They pet each other with their tails as a form of greeting. Of the two, the one whose tail is fluffier is a bit more boastful.

name: Cinccino
descriptionX: Its body secretes oil that this Pokémon spreads over its nest as a coating to protect it from dust. Cinccino won’t tolerate even a speck of the stuff.
descriptionY: A special oil that seeps through their fur helps them avoid attacks. The oil fetches a high price at market.

name: Gothita
descriptionX: This Pokémon is normally very innocent. When it is staring at something invisible, it is unblinking and utterly silent.
descriptionY: Beware of touching the ribbon-shaped feelers that control its psychic power. Gothita will begin bawling if you do.

name: Gothorita
descriptionX: This Pokémon will hypnotize children to put them to sleep before carrying them away. Be wary of nights when the starlight is bright.
descriptionY: Using its psychic power, it arranges pebbles to form the shapes of constellations. Some people believe this Pokémon came from outer space.

name: Gothitelle
descriptionX: Gothitelle unleashes psychic energy and shows opponents dreams of the universe’s end. These dreams are apparently ethereal and beautiful.
descriptionY: It gazes at the stars to predict the future. It acts somewhat detached because it has seen the end of all existence.

name: Solosis
descriptionX: It communicates with others telepathically. Its body is encapsulated in liquid, but if it takes a heavy blow, the liquid will leak out.
descriptionY: Many say that the special liquid covering this Pokémon’s body would allow it to survive in the vacuum of space.

name: Duosion
descriptionX: Its psychic power can supposedly cover a range of more than half a mile—but only if its two brains can agree with each other.
descriptionY: Its brain has split into two, and the two halves rarely think alike. Its actions are utterly unpredictable.

name: Reuniclus
descriptionX: While it could use its psychic abilities in battle, this Pokémon prefers to swing its powerful arms around to beat opponents into submission.
descriptionY: It’s said that drinking the liquid surrounding Reuniclus grants wisdom. Problem is, the liquid is highly toxic to anything besides Reuniclus itself.

name: Ducklett
descriptionX: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.
descriptionY: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.

name: Swanna
descriptionX: Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.
descriptionY: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

name: Vanillite
descriptionX: Unable to survive in hot areas, it makes itself comfortable by breathing out air cold enough to cause snow. It burrows into the snow to sleep.
descriptionY: Supposedly, this Pokémon was born from an icicle. It spews out freezing air at −58 degrees Fahrenheit to make itself more comfortable.

name: Vanillish
descriptionX: By drinking pure water, it grows its icy body. This Pokémon can be hard to find on days with warm, sunny weather.
descriptionY: It blasts enemies with cold air reaching −148 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it spares their lives afterward—it’s a kind Pokémon.

name: Vanilluxe
descriptionX: When its anger reaches a breaking point, this Pokémon unleashes a fierce blizzard that freezes every creature around it, be they friend or foe.
descriptionY: People believe this Pokémon formed when two Vanillish stuck together. Its body temperature is roughly 21 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Spring Form Deerling
descriptionX: Deerling have different scents depending on the season. In early spring, these Pokémon give off a delicate, sweet, and calming scent.
descriptionY: Despite Deerling’s adorable appearance, farmers consider it a nuisance since it loves plant shoots and will eat them all up.

name: Summer Form Deerling
descriptionX: To prevent Deerling from entering their fields, many farmers will have several Lycanroc stand guard, as they are the natural enemy of Deerling.
descriptionY: Deerling have different scents depending on the season. When a distinct grassy smell starts to waft from one, you know that summer has begun.

name: Autumn Form Deerling
descriptionX: These Pokémon are not shy—they will behave as they please, even in front of people. If you feed one of them, it will quickly take a liking to you.
descriptionY: Deerling have different scents depending on the season. In this form, Deerling have a softly sweet scent that lingers in the nose.

name: Winter Form Deerling
descriptionX: Deerling’s scent changes with the seasons, but when the Pokémon is in its Winter Form, it has hardly any scent at all.
descriptionY: This Pokémon will playfully headbutt those it gets along well with. It has antlers hidden under its flower, so the headbutts are a little painful.

name: Spring Form Sawsbuck
descriptionX: It seems that a Sawsbuck with many flowers on its antlers will grow at a slightly slower pace because the flowers absorb the Pokémon’s nutrients.
descriptionY: There are many Sawsbuck enthusiasts. The paler the pink flowers that bloom on its antlers, the more beautiful the Sawsbuck is considered to be.

name: Summer Form Sawsbuck
descriptionX: There are many Sawsbuck enthusiasts. The thicker and larger the branches and leaves on its antlers, the more majestic the Sawsbuck is thought to be.
descriptionY: This Pokémon’s leaves can be made into a black tea, the taste of which varies depending on the region of origin. Paldea’s is especially aromatic.

name: Autumn Form Sawsbuck
descriptionX: There are many Sawsbuck enthusiasts. The darker the red of the foliage that hangs from its antlers, the more stylish the Sawsbuck is thought to be.
descriptionY: Sawsbuck in their Autumn Form are known for having very short tempers. The males fight each other incessantly.

name: Winter Form Sawsbuck
descriptionX: It’s said that Sawsbuck are calm and easy to tame during the season when they take on this form, so it’s the perfect time to make one your partner.
descriptionY: Though there are many enthusiasts for Sawsbuck as a species, this seasonal form in particular is not very popular.

name: Emolga
descriptionX: As Emolga flutters through the air, it crackles with electricity. This Pokémon is cute, but it can cause a lot of trouble.
descriptionY: This Pokémon absolutely loves sweet berries. Sometimes it stuffs its cheeks full of so much food that it can’t fly properly.

name: Karrablast
descriptionX: Its strange physiology reacts to electrical energy in interesting ways. The presence of a Shelmet will cause this Pokémon to evolve.
descriptionY: It spits a liquid from its mouth to melt through Shelmet’s shell. Karrablast doesn’t eat the shell— it eats only the contents.

name: Escavalier
descriptionX: They use shells they’ve stolen from Shelmet to arm and protect themselves. They’re very popular Pokémon in the Galar region.
descriptionY: It charges its enemies, lances at the ready. An image of one of its duels is captured in a famous painting of Escavalier clashing with Sirfetch’d.

name: Foongus
descriptionX: There is a theory that the developer of the modern-day Poké Ball really liked Foongus, but this has not been confirmed.
descriptionY: This Pokémon prefers damp places. It spurts out poison spores to repel approaching enemies.

name: Amoonguss
descriptionX: Be wary of the poisonous spores it releases. Mushrooms resembling Amoonguss’s caps will grow out of anywhere the spores touch.
descriptionY: Amoonguss mimics Poké Balls. It is not yet clear whether this mimicry is effective against other Pokémon.

name: Male
descriptionX: It envelops its prey in its veillike arms and draws it down to the deeps, five miles below the ocean’s surface.
descriptionY: Legend has it that the residents of a sunken ancient city changed into these Pokémon.

name: Female
descriptionX: It envelops its prey in its veillike arms and draws it down to the deeps, five miles below the ocean’s surface.
descriptionY: Its thin, veillike arms have tens of thousands of poisonous stingers. Females have slightly longer stingers.

name: Male
descriptionX: Most of this Pokémon’s body composition is identical to sea water. It makes sunken ships its lair.
descriptionY: Whenever a full moon hangs in the night sky, schools of Jellicent gather near the surface of the sea, waiting for their prey to appear.

name: Female
descriptionX: These Pokémon have body compositions that are mostly identical to seawater. They make their lairs from sunken ships.
descriptionY: The crown on its head gets bigger and bigger as it absorbs more and more of the life-force of other creatures.

name: Alomomola
descriptionX: It gently holds injured and weak Pokémon in its fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.
descriptionY: They float upon the open sea. Many water Pokémon gather in the area around Alomomola.

name: Joltik
descriptionX: Joltik can be found clinging to other Pokémon. It’s soaking up static electricity because it can’t produce a charge on its own.
descriptionY: Joltik latch on to other Pokémon and suck out static electricity. They’re often found sticking to Yamper’s hindquarters.

name: Galvantula
descriptionX: It launches electrified fur from its abdomen as its means of attack. Opponents hit by the fur could be in for three full days and nights of paralysis.
descriptionY: It lays traps of electrified threads near the nests of bird Pokémon, aiming to snare chicks that are not yet good at flying.

name: Ferroseed
descriptionX: It defends itself by launching spikes, but its aim isn’t very good at first. Only after a lot of practice will it improve.
descriptionY: Mossy caves are their preferred dwellings. Enzymes contained in mosses help Ferroseed’s spikes grow big and strong.

name: Ferrothorn
descriptionX: This Pokémon scrapes its spikes across rocks, and then uses the tips of its feelers to absorb the nutrients it finds within the stone.
descriptionY: Its spikes are harder than steel. This Pokémon crawls across rock walls by stabbing the spikes on its feelers into the stone.

name: Klink
descriptionX: The two minigears that compose this Pokémon are closer than twins. They mesh well only with each other.
descriptionY: It’s suspected that Klink were the inspiration behind ancient people’s invention of the first gears.

name: Klang
descriptionX: When Klang goes all out, the minigear links up perfectly with the outer part of the big gear, and this Pokémon’s rotation speed increases sharply.
descriptionY: Many companies in the Galar region choose Klang as their logo. This Pokémon is considered the symbol of industrial technology.

name: Klinklang
descriptionX: From its spikes, it launches powerful blasts of electricity. Its red core contains an enormous amount of energy.
descriptionY: The three gears that compose this Pokémon spin at high speed. Its new spiked gear isn’t a living creature.

name: Tynamo
descriptionX: While one alone doesn’t have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.
descriptionY: These Pokémon move in schools. They have an electricity-generating organ, so they discharge electricity if in danger.

name: Eelektrik
descriptionX: They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.
descriptionY: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

name: Eelektross
descriptionX: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.
descriptionY: It latches on to prey with its sucker mouth, sinking in its fangs and shocking the prey with powerful electricity.

name: Elgyem
descriptionX: If this Pokémon stands near a TV, strange scenery will appear on the screen. That scenery is said to be from its home.
descriptionY: This Pokémon was discovered about 50 years ago. Its highly developed brain enables it to exert its psychic powers.

name: Beheeyem
descriptionX: Whenever a Beheeyem visits a farm, a Dubwool mysteriously disappears.
descriptionY: Sometimes found drifting above wheat fields, this Pokémon can control the memories of its opponents.

name: Litwick
descriptionX: The flame on its head keeps its body slightly warm. This Pokémon takes lost children by the hand to guide them to the spirit world.
descriptionY: The younger the life this Pokémon absorbs, the brighter and eerier the flame on its head burns.

name: Lampent
descriptionX: This Pokémon appears just before someone passes away, so it’s feared as an emissary of death.
descriptionY: It lurks in cities, pretending to be a lamp. Once it finds someone whose death is near, it will trail quietly after them.

name: Chandelure
descriptionX: This Pokémon haunts dilapidated mansions. It sways its arms to hypnotize opponents with the ominous dancing of its flames.
descriptionY: In homes illuminated by Chandelure instead of lights, funerals were a constant occurrence— or so it’s said.

name: Axew
descriptionX: This Pokémon lives in nests that are made in the ground. People in ancient times used its tusks as cooking knives.
descriptionY: If you see peculiar teeth marks on boulders or trees, it means an Axew is likely living nearby.

name: Fraxure
descriptionX: Because its tusks don’t grow back once they break, this Pokémon apparently won’t use them unless truly necessary.
descriptionY: Fraxure uses its thick tusks to neatly cut prey into two portions—one to eat now and one to save for later.

name: Haxorus
descriptionX: This Pokémon nests in caves and abandoned mines. It is docile, but it will become incredibly angry if its tusks are touched, so beware.
descriptionY: It overwhelms enemies with its prized tusks, which are sharp enough to cut through a metal transmission tower in one strike.

name: Cubchoo
descriptionX: Many of this species can be found along the shorelines of cold regions. If a Cubchoo lacks dangling snot, there’s a chance it is sick.
descriptionY: When Cubchoo starts sneezing, watch out! If it spatters you with its frosty snot, you’ll get frostbite.

name: Beartic
descriptionX: It is a ferocious, carnivorous Pokémon. Once it captures its prey, it will breathe cold air onto the prey to freeze and preserve it.
descriptionY: Feared as the Snow-White Demon in northern lands, Beartic uses its frosty claws and fangs to attack prey.

name: Cryogonal
descriptionX: Cryogonal appear during cold seasons. It is said that people and Pokémon who die on snowy mountains are reborn into these Pokémon.
descriptionY: Cryogonal uses its chains of ice to constrict its opponents and then flash-freezes them where they stand.

name: Shelmet
descriptionX: When attacked, it tightly shuts the lid of its shell. This reaction fails to protect it from Karrablast, however, because they can still get into the shell.
descriptionY: It has a strange physiology that responds to electricity. When together with Karrablast, Shelmet evolves for some reason.

name: Accelgor
descriptionX: It moves with blinding speed and lobs poison at foes. Featuring Accelgor as a main character is a surefire way to make a movie or comic popular.
descriptionY: Discarding its shell made it nimble. To keep itself from dehydrating, it wraps its body in bands of membrane.

name: Stunfisk
descriptionX: Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. It smiles when transmitting electricity.
descriptionY: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.

name: Galarian Stunfisk
descriptionX: Living in mud with a high iron content has given it a strong steel body.
descriptionY: Its conspicuous lips lure prey in as it lies in wait in the mud. When prey gets close, Stunfisk clamps its jagged steel fins down on them.

name: Mienfoo
descriptionX: In one minute, a well-trained Mienfoo can chop with its arms more than 100 times.
descriptionY: Though small, Mienfoo’s temperament is fierce. Any creature that approaches Mienfoo carelessly will be greeted with a flurry of graceful attacks.

name: Mienshao
descriptionX: When Mienshao comes across a truly challenging opponent, it will lighten itself by biting off the fur on its arms.
descriptionY: Delivered at blinding speeds, kicks from this Pokémon can shatter massive boulders into tiny pieces.

name: Druddigon
descriptionX: Druddigon lives in caves, but it never skips sunbathing—it won’t be able to move if its body gets too cold.
descriptionY: Druddigon are vicious and cunning. They take up residence in nests dug out by other Pokémon, treating the stolen nests as their own lairs.

name: Golett
descriptionX: They were sculpted from clay in ancient times. No one knows why, but some of them are driven to continually line up boulders.
descriptionY: This Pokémon was created from clay. It received orders from its master many thousands of years ago, and it still follows those orders to this day.

name: Golurk
descriptionX: Artillery platforms built into the walls of ancient castles served as perches from which Golurk could fire energy beams.
descriptionY: There’s a theory that inside Golurk is a perpetual motion machine that produces limitless energy, but this belief hasn’t been proven.

name: Pawniard
descriptionX: Pawniard will fearlessly challenge even powerful foes. In a pinch, it will cling to opponents and pierce them with the blades all over its body.
descriptionY: Any chips in its blades would prove fatal for it. After each battle, it diligently maintains its blades using its favorite sharpening stone.

name: Bisharp
descriptionX: This Pokémon commands a group of several Pawniard. Groups that are defeated in territorial disputes are absorbed by the winning side.
descriptionY: Bisharp mercilessly cuts its opponents to pieces with the sharp blades covering its body. It will do anything to win.

name: Bouffalant
descriptionX: These Pokémon can crush a car with no more than a headbutt. Bouffalant with more hair on their heads hold higher positions within the herd.
descriptionY: These Pokémon live in herds of about 20 individuals. Bouffalant that betray the herd will lose the hair on their heads for some reason.

name: Rufflet
descriptionX: They pick fights indiscriminately. They grow stronger and more powerful each time they faint or are injured.
descriptionY: With its sharp claws, this Pokémon pierces its prey, and then it pecks at them. Although it also consumes berries, it’s a carnivore at heart.

name: Braviary
descriptionX: The more scars they have, the more respect these brave soldiers of the sky get from their peers.
descriptionY: For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of the sky will not stop battling, even if injured.

name: Hisuian Braviary
descriptionX: Screaming a bloodcurdling battle cry, this huge and ferocious bird Pokémon goes out on the hunt. It blasts lakes with shock waves, then scoops up any prey that float to the water’s surface.
descriptionY: Screaming a bloodcurdling battle cry, this huge and ferocious bird Pokémon goes out on the hunt. It blasts lakes with shock waves, then scoops up any prey that float to the water’s surface.

name: Vullaby
descriptionX: It wears a bone to protect its rear. It often squabbles with others of its kind over particularly comfy bones.
descriptionY: Vullaby grow quickly. Bones that have gotten too small for older Vullaby to wear often get passed down to younger ones in the nest.

name: Mandibuzz
descriptionX: Although it’s a bit of a ruffian, this Pokémon will take lost Vullaby under its wing and care for them till they’re ready to leave the nest.
descriptionY: They adorn themselves with bones. There seem to be fashion trends among them, as different bones come into and fall out of popularity.

name: Heatmor
descriptionX: There’s a hole in its tail that allows it to draw in the air it needs to keep its fire burning. If the hole gets blocked, this Pokémon will fall ill.
descriptionY: A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour their insides.

name: Durant
descriptionX: They lay their eggs deep inside their nests. When attacked by Heatmor, they retaliate using their massive mandibles.
descriptionY: With their large mandibles, these Pokémon can crunch their way through rock. They work together to protect their eggs from Sandaconda.

name: Deino
descriptionX: It can’t see, so its first approach to examining things is to bite them. You will be covered in wounds until a Deino warms up to you.
descriptionY: It nests deep inside a cave. Food there is scarce, so Deino will sink its teeth into anything that moves and attempt to eat it.

name: Zweilous
descriptionX: The two heads do not get along at all. If you don’t give each head the same amount of attention, they’ll begin fighting out of jealousy.
descriptionY: The two heads have different likes and dislikes. Because the heads fight with each other, Zweilous gets stronger without needing to rely on others.

name: Hydreigon
descriptionX: Only the central head has a brain. It is very intelligent, but it thinks only of destruction.
descriptionY: It’s said that Hydreigon grew ferocious because people in times long past loathed it, considering it to be evil incarnate and attacking it relentlessly.

name: Larvesta
descriptionX: This Pokémon was called the Larva That Stole the Sun. The fire Larvesta spouts from its horns can cut right through a sheet of iron.
descriptionY: In ancient times, Larvesta was worshiped as the emissary of the sun. However, it was also viewed as a burden since it often caused forest fires.

name: Volcarona
descriptionX: Its burning body causes it to be unpopular in hot parts of the world, but in cold ones, Volcarona is revered as an embodiment of the sun.
descriptionY: This Pokémon scatters burning scales. Most of the danger of these scales is not in their heat—it’s in the way they rob the surrounding air of oxygen.

name: Cobalion
descriptionX: This Pokémon appears in a legend alongside Terrakion and Virizion, fighting against humans in defense of the Unova region’s Pokémon.
descriptionY: From the moment it’s born, this Pokémon radiates the air of a leader. Its presence will calm even vicious foes.

name: Terrakion
descriptionX: It has phenomenal power. It will mercilessly crush anyone or anything that bullies small Pokémon.
descriptionY: In Unovan legend, Terrakion battled against humans in an effort to protect other Pokémon.

name: Virizion
descriptionX: A legend tells of this Pokémon working together with Cobalion and Terrakion to protect the Pokémon of the Unova region.
descriptionY: It darts around opponents with a flurry of quick movements, slicing them up with its horns.

name: Incarnate Forme
descriptionX: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.
descriptionY: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.

name: Therian Forme
descriptionX: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.
descriptionY: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.

name: Incarnate Forme
descriptionX: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.
descriptionY: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.

name: Therian Forme
descriptionX: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.
descriptionY: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.

name: Reshiram
descriptionX: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with fire. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.
descriptionY: When Reshiram’s tail flares, the heat energy moves the atmosphere and changes the world’s weather.

name: Zekrom
descriptionX: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.
descriptionY: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.

name: Incarnate Forme
descriptionX: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as “The Guardian of the Fields.”
descriptionY: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.

name: Therian Forme
descriptionX: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as “The Guardian of the Fields.”
descriptionY: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.

name: Kyurem
descriptionX: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.
descriptionY: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

name: White Kyurem
descriptionX: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.
descriptionY: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

name: Black Kyurem
descriptionX: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.
descriptionY: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

name: Ordinary Form
descriptionX: It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.
descriptionY: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.

name: Resolute Form
descriptionX: It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.
descriptionY: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.

name: Aria Forme
descriptionX: The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad.
descriptionY: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.

name: Pirouette Forme
descriptionX: The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad.
descriptionY: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.

name: Genesect
descriptionX: This ancient bug Pokémon was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.
descriptionY: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.

name: Chespin
descriptionX: The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.
descriptionY: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn’t faze it.

name: Quilladin
descriptionX: It relies on its sturdy shell to deflect predators’ attacks. It counterattacks with its sharp quills.
descriptionY: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won’t start fights.

name: Chesnaught
descriptionX: Its Tackle is forceful enough to flip a 50-ton tank. It shields its allies from danger with its own body.
descriptionY: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.

name: Fennekin
descriptionX: Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.
descriptionY: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

name: Braixen
descriptionX: It has a twig stuck in its tail. With friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.
descriptionY: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.

name: Delphox
descriptionX: It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.
descriptionY: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.

name: Froakie
descriptionX: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.
descriptionY: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

name: Frogadier
descriptionX: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.
descriptionY: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute’s time.

name: Greninja
descriptionX: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.
descriptionY: It appears and vanishes with a ninja’s grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.

name: Ash-Greninja
descriptionX: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.
descriptionY: It appears and vanishes with a ninja’s grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.

name: Bunnelby
descriptionX: It excels at digging holes. Using its ears, it can dig a nest 33 feet deep in one night.
descriptionY: It’s very sensitive to danger. The sound of Corviknight’s flapping will have Bunnelby digging a hole to hide underground in moments.

name: Diggersby
descriptionX: With power equal to an excavator, it can dig through dense bedrock. It’s a huge help during tunnel construction.
descriptionY: The fur on its belly retains heat exceptionally well. People used to make heavy winter clothing from fur shed by this Pokémon.

name: Fletchling
descriptionX: This Pokémon is normally calm, but once it enters battle, its hormonal balance changes and it becomes aggressive.
descriptionY: Fletchling can be found in both rural and urban areas. They once had a huge territorial dispute with Squawkabilly. Fights broke out all over town.

name: Fletchinder
descriptionX: Fletchinder scatters embers in tall grass where bug Pokémon might be hiding and then catches them as they come leaping out.
descriptionY: Its territory has a radius of just over a mile. If any bird Pokémon should enter, it will show them no mercy.

name: Talonflame
descriptionX: It has top-notch flying capabilities. It flies around easily, even while carrying prey that weighs more than 220 lbs.
descriptionY: When it gets excited, it vents sparks from the gaps between its feathers. These unburnable feathers are used as a fireproof material.

name: Scatterbug
descriptionX: Any poison this Pokémon takes in is converted into a black powder and secreted. That’s why Scatterbug can eat poisonous leaves and roots.
descriptionY: This Pokémon scatters poisonous powder to repel enemies. It will eat different plants depending on where it lives.

name: Spewpa
descriptionX: If Rufflet attacks this Pokémon by pecking at it, it will retaliate with its sharp fur and poisonous black powder.
descriptionY: Spewpa doesn’t live in a fixed location. It roams where it pleases across the fields and mountains, building up the energy it needs to evolve.

name: Meadow Pattern Vivillon
descriptionX: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands where flowers bloom.
descriptionY: This Pokémon was born in a land where flowers bloom. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

name: Continental Pattern Vivillon
descriptionX: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands of vast space.
descriptionY: This Pokémon was born in a land of vast space. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

name: Garden Pattern Vivillon
descriptionX: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from verdant lands.
descriptionY: This Pokémon was born in a verdant land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

name: Elegant Pattern Vivillon
descriptionX: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands with distinct seasons.
descriptionY: This Pokémon was born in a land with distinct seasons. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

name: Marine Pattern Vivillon
descriptionX: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands with ocean breezes.
descriptionY: This Pokémon was born in a land with ocean breezes. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

name: High Plains Pattern Vivillon
descriptionX: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands with little rain.
descriptionY: This Pokémon was born in a land with little rain. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

name: River Pattern Vivillon
descriptionX: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands where large rivers flow.
descriptionY: This Pokémon was born in a land where large rivers flow. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

name: Fancy Pattern Vivillon
descriptionX: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from a mysterious land.
descriptionY: This Pokémon was born in a mysterious land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

name: Litleo
descriptionX: When Litleo are young, female Pyroar will teach them how to hunt. Once the Litleo mature, they will leave the pride and set out on their own.
descriptionY: The more a Litleo trains its body and spirit by battling mighty enemies, the hotter its mane will grow.

name: Male Pyroar
descriptionX: The females of a pride work together to bring down prey. It’s thanks to them that their pride doesn’t starve.
descriptionY: The mane of a male Pyroar heats up to over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit during battle. Merely approaching it will cause severe burns.

name: Female Pyroar
descriptionX: The females of a pride work together to bring down prey. It’s thanks to them that their pride doesn’t starve.
descriptionY: The mane of a male Pyroar heats up to over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit during battle. Merely approaching it will cause severe burns.

name: Flabébé
descriptionX: This Pokémon can draw forth the power hidden within blooming wild flowers. It is particularly fond of red flowers.
descriptionY: This Flabébé rides a red flower. Immediately after birth, this Pokémon begins flying around in search of a flower it likes.

name: Floette
descriptionX: This Pokémon draws forth what power is left in withered flowers to make them healthy again. It holds a red flower.
descriptionY: This Pokémon uses red wavelengths of light to pour its own energy into flowers and draw forth their latent potential.

name: Florges
descriptionX: This Pokémon creates an impressive flower garden in its territory. It draws forth the power of the red flowers around its neck.
descriptionY: They say that flower gardens created by Florges are constantly showered with a power that can heal both body and spirit.

name: Skiddo
descriptionX: Until recently, people living in the mountains would ride on the backs of these Pokémon to traverse the mountain paths.
descriptionY: As long as it has sunlight and water, Skiddo can make energy with the leaves on its body, allowing it to live on rocky mountains barren of food.

name: Gogoat
descriptionX: It can sense the feelings of others by touching them with its horns. This species has assisted people with their work since 5,000 years ago.
descriptionY: These Pokémon live in herds in mountainous places. The victor in their contests of clashing horns will become the leader of the herd.

name: Pancham
descriptionX: It chooses a Pangoro as its master and then imitates its master’s actions. This is how it learns to battle and hunt for prey.
descriptionY: Wanting to make sure it’s taken seriously, Pancham’s always giving others a glare. But if it’s not focusing, it ends up smiling.

name: Pangoro
descriptionX: This Pokémon is quick to anger, and it has no problem using its prodigious strength to get its way. It lives for duels against Obstagoon.
descriptionY: Using its leaf, Pangoro can predict the moves of its opponents. It strikes with punches that can turn a dump truck into scrap with just one hit.

name: Natural Form
descriptionX: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou’s fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptionY: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

name: Heart Trim
descriptionX: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou’s fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptionY: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

name: Star Trim
descriptionX: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou’s fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptionY: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

name: Diamond Trim
descriptionX: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou’s fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptionY: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

name: Espurr
descriptionX: Though Espurr’s expression never changes, behind that blank stare is an intense struggle to contain its devastating psychic power.
descriptionY: There’s enough psychic power in Espurr to send a wrestler flying, but because this power can’t be controlled, Espurr finds it troublesome.

name: Male
descriptionX: Revealing the eyelike patterns on the insides of its ears will unleash its psychic powers. It normally keeps the patterns hidden, however.
descriptionY: The defensive instinct of the males is strong. It’s when they’re protecting themselves or their partners that they unleash their full power.

name: Female
descriptionX: Females are a bit more selfish and aggressive than males. If they don’t get what they want, they will torment you with their psychic abilities.
descriptionY: If it doesn’t hold back when it unleashes its psychic power, it can tear apart a tanker. Its unfriendliness is part of its charm.

name: Honedge
descriptionX: Honedge’s soul once belonged to a person who was killed a long time ago by the sword that makes up Honedge’s body.
descriptionY: The blue eye on the sword’s handguard is the true body of Honedge. With its old cloth, it drains people’s lives away.

name: Doublade
descriptionX: Honedge evolves into twins. The two blades rub together to emit a metallic sound that unnerves opponents.
descriptionY: The two swords employ a strategy of rapidly alternating between offense and defense to bring down their prey.

name: Shield Forme
descriptionX: In this defensive stance, Aegislash uses its steel body and a force field of spectral power to reduce the damage of any attack.
descriptionY: Its potent spectral powers allow it to manipulate others. It once used its powers to force people and Pokémon to build a kingdom to its liking.

name: Blade Forme
descriptionX: This stance is dedicated to offense. It can cleave any opponent with the strength and weight of its steel blade.
descriptionY: Once upon a time, a king with an Aegislash reigned over the land. His Pokémon eventually drained him of life, and his kingdom fell with him.

name: Spritzee
descriptionX: A scent pouch within this Pokémon’s body allows it to create various scents. A change in its diet will alter the fragrance it produces.
