descriptionY: The scent its body gives off enraptures those who smell it. Noble ladies had no shortage of love for Spritzee.

name: Aromatisse
descriptionX: The scent that constantly emits from its fur is so powerful that this Pokémon’s companions will eventually lose their sense of smell.
descriptionY: The scents Aromatisse can produce range from sweet smells that bolster allies to foul smells that sap an opponent’s will to fight.

name: Swirlix
descriptionX: It eats its own weight in sugar every day. If it doesn’t get enough sugar, it becomes incredibly grumpy.
descriptionY: The sweet smell of cotton candy perfumes Swirlix’s fluffy fur. This Pokémon spits out sticky string to tangle up its enemies.

name: Slurpuff
descriptionX: By taking in a person’s scent, it can sniff out their mental and physical condition. It’s hoped that this skill will have many medical applications.
descriptionY: Slurpuff’s fur contains a lot of air, making it soft to the touch and lighter than it looks.

name: Inkay
descriptionX: It spins while making its luminescent spots flash. These spots allow it to communicate with others by using different patterns of light.
descriptionY: By exposing foes to the blinking of its luminescent spots, Inkay demoralizes them, and then it seizes the chance to flee.

name: Malamar
descriptionX: Gazing at its luminescent spots will quickly induce a hypnotic state, putting the observer under Malamar’s control.
descriptionY: It’s said that Malamar’s hypnotic powers played a role in certain history-changing events.

name: Binacle
descriptionX: After two Binacle find a suitably sized rock, they adhere themselves to it and live together. They cooperate to gather food during high tide.
descriptionY: If the two don’t work well together, both their offense and defense fall apart. Without good teamwork, they won’t survive.

name: Barbaracle
descriptionX: Seven Binacle come together to form one Barbaracle. The Binacle that serves as the head gives orders to those serving as the limbs.
descriptionY: Having an eye on each palm allows it to keep watch in all directions. In a pinch, its limbs start to act on their own to ensure the enemy’s defeat.

name: Skrelp
descriptionX: Skrelp evades its enemies by hiding amid drifting seaweed. It eats rotten seaweed to create its poison.
descriptionY: This Pokémon is a poor swimmer. If it’s caught in a fierce storm, it will sometimes get washed far away and become unable to return to its home.

name: Dragalge
descriptionX: Using a liquid poison, Dragalge indiscriminately attacks anything that wanders into its territory. This poison can corrode the undersides of boats.
descriptionY: Since Finizen is the better swimmer, Dragalge will approach it under the cover of seaweed, then immobilize it with a poisonous attack.

name: Clauncher
descriptionX: This Pokémon launches water by detonating gas inside its right claw. It snipes flying Pokémon.
descriptionY: Clauncher’s claws will regrow if they fall off. The meat inside the claws is edible, but it has a distinct flavor that doesn’t appeal to all tastes.

name: Clawitzer
descriptionX: Clawitzer can move through the water at a speed of 60 knots by using gas inside its body to expel water from the back of its claw.
descriptionY: The cannonballs of seawater that Clawitzer launches from its claw are powerful enough to punch through tanker hulls.

name: Helioptile
descriptionX: When spread, the frills on its head act like solar panels, generating the power behind this Pokémon’s electric moves.
descriptionY: The sun powers this Pokémon’s electricity generation. Interruption of that process stresses Helioptile to the point of weakness.

name: Heliolisk
descriptionX: A now-vanished desert culture treasured these Pokémon. Appropriately, when Heliolisk came to the Galar region, treasure came with them.
descriptionY: One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill outspread is all it would take to produce enough electricity to power a city.

name: Tyrunt
descriptionX: This is an ancient Pokémon, revived in modern times. It has a violent disposition, and it’ll tear apart anything it gets between its hefty jaws.
descriptionY: This Pokémon is selfish and likes to be pampered. It can also inflict grievous wounds on its Trainer just by playing around.

name: Tyrantrum
descriptionX: This Pokémon is from about 100,000,000 years ago. It has the presence of a king, vicious but magnificent.
descriptionY: A single bite of Tyrantrum’s massive jaws will demolish a car. This Pokémon was the king of the ancient world.

name: Amaura
descriptionX: This Pokémon was successfully restored from a fossil. In the past, it lived with others of its kind in cold lands where there were fewer predators.
descriptionY: Amaura is an ancient Pokémon that has gone extinct. Specimens of this species can sometimes be found frozen in ice.

name: Aurorus
descriptionX: Aurorus was restored from a fossil. It’s said that when this Pokémon howls, auroras appear in the night sky.
descriptionY: When gripped by rage, Aurorus will emanate freezing air, covering everything around it in ice.

name: Sylveon
descriptionX: This Pokémon uses its ribbonlike feelers to send a soothing aura into its opponents, erasing their hostility.
descriptionY: Sylveon cuts an elegant figure as it dances lightly around, feelers fluttering, but its piercing moves aim straight for its opponents’ weak spots.

name: Hawlucha
descriptionX: Its elegant finishing moves—performed by nimbly leaping around using its wings—are polished in the forest where it was born and raised.
descriptionY: Hawlucha live quietly without flocking together. They fight constantly with their natural enemies: noisy groups of Primeape.

name: Dedenne
descriptionX: It’s small and its electricity-generating organ is not fully developed, so it uses its tail to absorb electricity from people’s homes and charge itself.
descriptionY: Dedenne emit electrical waves from the whiskers on their cheeks to communicate with each other. When low on electricity, they curl up and sleep.

name: Carbink
descriptionX: When beset by attackers, Carbink wipes them all out by firing high-energy beams from the gems embedded in its body.
descriptionY: It’s said that somewhere in the world, there’s a mineral vein housing a large pack of slumbering Carbink. It’s also said that this pack has a queen.

name: Goomy
descriptionX: Most of a Goomy’s body is water. A membrane covers the whole Pokémon to prevent it from shriveling up in dry weather.
descriptionY: Goomy’s horns are excellent sensory organs that cover all five of Goomy’s senses. Goomy picks up on danger from the movement of the air.

name: Sliggoo
descriptionX: The swirly protrusion on its back is filled with all its vital organs, such as its brain and heart.
descriptionY: When Sliggoo senses danger, the mucus coating its entire body becomes more concentrated—it’ll dissolve anything.

name: Hisuian Sliggoo
descriptionX: A creature given to melancholy. I suspect its metallic shell developed as a result of the mucus on its skin reacting with the iron in Hisui’s water.
descriptionY: A creature given to melancholy. I suspect its metallic shell developed as a result of the mucus on its skin reacting with the iron in Hisui’s water.

name: Goodra
descriptionX: It loves the rain. This mellow Pokémon can be seen walking around on the plains and in the mountains on rainy days.
descriptionY: This Pokémon is uncontrollable when enraged. It rampages on and on, lashing its tail with enough power to send a dump truck flying.

name: Hisuian Goodra
descriptionX: Able to freely control the hardness of its metallic shell. It loathes solitude and is extremely clingy—it will fume and run riot if those dearest to it ever leave its side.
descriptionY: Able to freely control the hardness of its metallic shell. It loathes solitude and is extremely clingy—it will fume and run riot if those dearest to it ever leave its side.

name: Klefki
descriptionX: Once it absorbs a key’s metal ions, it discards the key without a second thought. However, it will hang on to keys it favors for decades.
descriptionY: In the past, noble families entrusted their vault keys to a Klefki. They passed the Klefki down through the generations, taking good care of it.

name: Phantump
descriptionX: After a lost child perished in the forest, their spirit possessed a tree stump, causing the spirit’s rebirth as this Pokémon.
descriptionY: With a voice like a human child’s, it cries out to lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost among the trees.

name: Trevenant
descriptionX: People fear it due to a belief that it devours any who try to cut down trees in its forest, but to the Pokémon it shares its woods with, it’s kind.
descriptionY: Small roots that extend from the tips of this Pokémon’s feet can tie into the trees of the forest and give Trevenant control over them.

name: Pumpkaboo
descriptionX: Spirits that wander this world are placed into Pumpkaboo’s body. They’re then moved on to the afterlife.
descriptionY: The light that streams out from the holes in the pumpkin can hypnotize and control the people and Pokémon that see it.

name: Gourgeist
descriptionX: Eerie cries emanate from its body in the dead of night. The sounds are said to be the wails of spirits who are suffering in the afterlife.
descriptionY: In the darkness of a new-moon night, Gourgeist will come knocking. Whoever answers the door will be swept off to the afterlife.

name: Bergmite
descriptionX: They live in mountainous regions of frigid cold. On rare occasions, they ride on the back of an Avalugg to cross seas and move to new habitats.
descriptionY: Bergmite protects itself by coating its body in ice formed by frigid air of −148 degrees Fahrenheit. It fights with Frigibax whenever they meet.

name: Avalugg
descriptionX: As Avalugg walks along with Bergmite on its back, it comes across pods of Cetitan. It lets them pass to avoid conflict.
descriptionY: This Pokémon uses its massive icy body to flatten anything that gets in its way. When it’s floating out on the ocean, it looks exactly like drift ice.

name: Hisuian Avalugg
descriptionX: The armor of ice covering its lower jaw puts steel to shame and can shatter rocks with ease. This Pokémon barrels along steep mountain paths, cleaving through the deep snow.
descriptionY: The armor of ice covering its lower jaw puts steel to shame and can shatter rocks with ease. This Pokémon barrels along steep mountain paths, cleaving through the deep snow.

name: Noibat
descriptionX: This Pokémon emits ultrasonic waves from its large ears to search for fruit to eat. It mistakes Applin for its food.
descriptionY: Noibat can change the frequency of its sound waves at will, and it generates ultrasonic waves of up to 200,000 hertz.

name: Noivern
descriptionX: Ultrasonic waves emitted by a Noivern can pulverize a large boulder. This Pokémon has a cruel disposition.
descriptionY: In the dark, even Hydreigon are terrified of this Pokémon. But in the light, Noivern is the one that avoids battle.

name: Xerneas
descriptionX: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.
descriptionY: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.

name: Yveltal
descriptionX: When this legendary Pokémon’s wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.
descriptionY: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

name: 50% Forme
descriptionX: This is Zygarde’s form when about half of its pieces have been assembled. It plays the role of monitoring the ecosystem.
descriptionY: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.

name: 10% Forme
descriptionX: This is Zygarde when about 10% of its pieces have been assembled. It leaps at its opponent’s chest and sinks its sharp fangs into them.
descriptionY: Born when around 10% of Zygarde’s cells have been gathered from all over, this form is skilled in close-range combat.

name: Complete Forme
descriptionX: This is Zygarde’s perfected form. From the orifice on its chest, it radiates high-powered energy that eliminates everything.
descriptionY: Born when all of Zygarde’s cells have been gathered together, it uses force to neutralize those who harm the ecosystem.

name: Diancie
descriptionX: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.
descriptionY: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.

name: Mega Diancie
descriptionX: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.
descriptionY: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.

name: Hoopa Confined
descriptionX: In its true form, it possesses a huge amount of power. Legends of its avarice tell how it once carried off an entire castle to gain the treasure hidden within.
descriptionY: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.

name: Hoopa Unbound
descriptionX: In its true form, it possesses a huge amount of power. Legends of its avarice tell how it once carried off an entire castle to gain the treasure hidden within.
descriptionY: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.

name: Volcanion
descriptionX: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It’s said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.
descriptionY: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

name: Rowlet
descriptionX: It sends its feathers, which are as sharp as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong, so its kicks are also formidable.
descriptionY: It feels relaxed in tight, dark places and has been known to use its Trainer’s pocket or bag as a nest.

name: Dartrix
descriptionX: This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you don’t groom it diligently, it will stop listening to you.
descriptionY: Supremely sensitive to the presence of others, it can detect opponents standing behind it, flinging its sharp feathers to take them out.

name: Decidueye
descriptionX: It fires arrow quills from its wings with such precision, they can pierce a pebble at distances over a hundred yards.
descriptionY: Although basically cool and cautious, when it’s caught by surprise, it’s seized by panic.

name: Hisuian Decidueye
descriptionX: The air stored inside the rachises of Decidueye’s feathers insulates the Pokémon against Hisui’s extreme cold. This is firm proof that evolution can be influenced by environment.
descriptionY: The air stored inside the rachises of Decidueye’s feathers insulates the Pokémon against Hisui’s extreme cold. This is firm proof that evolution can be influenced by environment.

name: Litten
descriptionX: If you try too hard to get close to it, it won’t open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.
descriptionY: Its coat regrows twice a year. When the time comes, Litten sets its own body on fire and burns away the old fur.

name: Torracat
descriptionX: It can act spoiled if it grows close to its Trainer. A powerful Pokémon, its sharp claws can leave its Trainer’s whole body covered in scratches.
descriptionY: When its mane is standing on end, you can tell it’s feeling good. When it isn’t feeling well, its fur will lie down flat.

name: Incineroar
descriptionX: Although it’s rough mannered and egotistical, it finds beating down unworthy opponents boring. It gets motivated for stronger opponents.
descriptionY: When its fighting spirit is set alight, the flames around its waist become especially intense.

name: Popplio
descriptionX: The balloons it inflates with its nose grow larger and larger as it practices day by day.
descriptionY: Popplio gets on top of its bouncy water balloons to jump higher. It’s quite the acrobatic fighter!

name: Brionne
descriptionX: It gets excited when it sees a dance it doesn’t know. This hard worker practices diligently until it can learn that dance.
descriptionY: It attacks by smacking its enemies with the exploding water balloons that it creates.

name: Primarina
descriptionX: To Primarina, every battle is a stage. It takes down its prey with beautiful singing and dancing.
descriptionY: Also known as a songstress, it has a fantastical look on moonlit nights when it leads its colony in song.

name: Pikipek
descriptionX: It pecks at trees with its hard beak. You can get some idea of its mood or condition from the rhythm of its pecking.
descriptionY: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!

name: Trumbeak
descriptionX: It can bend the tip of its beak to produce over a hundred different cries at will.
descriptionY: From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise to new plants.

name: Toucannon
descriptionX: They smack beaks with others of their kind to communicate. The strength and number of hits tell each other how they feel.
descriptionY: Known for forming harmonious couples, this Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a good luck charm.

name: Yungoos
descriptionX: Its stomach fills most of its torso. It wanders the same path every day, searching for fresh food.
descriptionY: It spends its waking hours searching endlessly for food. When Yungoos is hungry, its ferocity gains a certain edge.

name: Gumshoos
descriptionX: Once it finds signs of prey, it will patiently stake out the location, waiting until the sun goes down.
descriptionY: Gumshoos specializes in relentlessly tracking down prey. The simple-minded Skwovet doesn’t seem to provide Gumshoos enough challenge.

name: Grubbin
descriptionX: Its natural enemies, like Rookidee, may flee rather than risk getting caught in its large mandibles that can snap thick tree branches.
descriptionY: It uses its big jaws to dig nests into the forest floor, and it loves to feed on sweet tree sap.

name: Charjabug
descriptionX: While its durable shell protects it from attacks, Charjabug strikes at enemies with jolts of electricity discharged from the tips of its jaws.
descriptionY: Its digestive processes convert the leaves it eats into electricity. An electric sac in its belly stores the electricity for later use.

name: Vikavolt
descriptionX: It builds up electricity in its abdomen, focuses it through its jaws, and then fires the electricity off in concentrated beams.
descriptionY: If it carries a Charjabug to use as a spare battery, a flying Vikavolt can rapidly fire high-powered beams of electricity.

name: Crabrawler
descriptionX: This Pokémon punches trees and eats the berries that drop down, training itself and getting food at the same time.
descriptionY: If it loses its pincers, they’ll quickly regrow. The pincers are popular ingredients in paella since their shells produce a tasty soup stock.

name: Crabominable
descriptionX: The detached pincers of these Pokémon are delicious. Some Trainers bring Lechonk into the mountains just to search for them.
descriptionY: Though its punches are powerful, this Pokémon’s movements are sluggish. It blows icy bubbles from its mouth to immobilize its opponents.

name: Baile Style Oricorio
descriptionX: This Pokémon is incredibly popular, possibly because its passionate dancing is a great match with the temperament of Paldean people.
descriptionY: This form of Oricorio has sipped red nectar. It whips up blazing flames as it moves to the steps of its passionate dance.

name: Pom-Pom Style Oricorio
descriptionX: This form of Oricorio has sipped yellow nectar. It uses nimble steps to approach opponents, then knocks them out with electric punches.
descriptionY: The energetic, cheerful dance of these Oricorio is popular with children, but the Oricorio themselves are hard to find in Paldea.

name: Pa’u Style Oricorio
descriptionX: The airy dance of these Oricorio is popular as a means of maintaining good health, but the Oricorio themselves are hard to find in Paldea.
descriptionY: This form of Oricorio has sipped pink nectar. It elevates its mind with the gentle steps of its dance, then unleashes its psychic energy.

name: Sensu Style Oricorio
descriptionX: This form of Oricorio has sipped purple nectar. It uses ethereal dance steps to call forth the spirits of the dead.
descriptionY: The elegant, attractive dance of these Oricorio is popular with adults, but the Oricorio themselves are hard to find in Paldea.

name: Cutiefly
descriptionX: Nectar and pollen are its favorite fare. You can find Cutiefly hovering around Gossifleur, trying to get some of Gossifleur’s pollen.
descriptionY: An opponent’s aura can tell Cutiefly what that opponent’s next move will be. Then Cutiefly can glide around the attack and strike back.

name: Ribombee
descriptionX: It makes pollen puffs from pollen and nectar. The puffs’ effects depend on the type of ingredients and how much of each one is used.
descriptionY: Ribombee absolutely hate getting wet or rained on. In the cloudy Galar region, they are very seldom seen.

name: Rockruff
descriptionX: This Pokémon is very friendly when it’s young. Its disposition becomes vicious once it matures, but it never forgets the kindness of its master.
descriptionY: This Pokémon travels in a pack with others until it grows up. When its mood turns sour, it starts striking the ground with the rocks on its neck.

name: Midday Form Lycanroc
descriptionX: Lycanroc attacks its prey with its sharp claws and fangs. It loyally obeys the instructions of a Trainer it trusts.
descriptionY: It has a calm and collected demeanor. It swiftly closes in on its prey, then slices them with the rocks in its mane.

name: Midnight Form Lycanroc
descriptionX: This Pokémon uses its rocky mane to slash any who approach. It will even disobey its Trainer if it dislikes the orders it was given.
descriptionY: This Lycanroc has an extremely vicious temperament. It will happily sustain injuries for the sake of taking down its opponent.

name: Dusk Form Lycanroc
descriptionX: Normally this Pokémon doesn’t even bark, but once it enters battle, it will relentlessly drive the opponent into a corner.
descriptionY: These Pokémon have both calm and ferocious qualities. It’s said that this form of Lycanroc is the most troublesome to raise.

name: Solo Form
descriptionX: Individually, they’re incredibly weak. It’s by gathering up into schools that they’re able to confront opponents.
descriptionY: When it senses danger, its eyes tear up. The sparkle of its tears signals other Wishiwashi to gather.

name: School Form
descriptionX: On their own, they’re very weak. But when Wishiwashi pool their power together in a school, they become a demon of the sea.
descriptionY: When facing tough opponents, they get into formation. But if they get wounded in battle, they’ll scatter and become solitary again.

name: Mareanie
descriptionX: This Pokémon wanders the seaside looking for food. It often gets electric shocks from broken Pincurchin spines that it tries to eat.
descriptionY: It has excellent regenerative capabilities. Legs that a Mareanie has lost have a very bitter, astringent flavor—they’re not suitable as food.

name: Toxapex
descriptionX: This Pokémon lives within a dome made by its own legs. Toxapex monitors its surroundings by sensing the flow of the tide through its spikes.
descriptionY: Toxapex gets into fierce battles with Bruxish over areas where warm ocean currents flow, but the odds are always against it.

name: Mudbray
descriptionX: This Pokémon covers itself in mud that it has regurgitated. The mud won’t dry out even if it’s exposed to the sun for a long time.
descriptionY: Though a slow walker, Mudbray is plenty strong. Its pace doesn’t change even when it’s loaded with 50 times its own body weight.

name: Mudsdale
descriptionX: This Pokémon has been treasured not just for its physical labor but also because it produces high-quality mud used for making pottery.
descriptionY: Its legs are fortified with mud and harder than stone, and they can reduce a large truck to scrap with one kick.

name: Dewpider
descriptionX: It forms a water bubble at the rear of its body and then covers its head with it. Meeting another Dewpider means comparing water-bubble sizes.
descriptionY: Dewpider normally lives underwater. When it comes onto land in search of food, it takes water with it in the form of a bubble on its head.

name: Araquanid
descriptionX: It launches water bubbles with its legs, drowning prey within the bubbles. This Pokémon can then take its time to savor its meal.
descriptionY: It acts as a caretaker for Dewpider, putting them inside its bubble and letting them eat any leftover food.

name: Fomantis
descriptionX: Fomantis hates having its naps interrupted. It fires off beams using energy it gathers by bathing in the sun.
descriptionY: Many Trainers give their Fomantis their own flowerpots so they can sunbathe in peace and quiet.

name: Lurantis
descriptionX: By masquerading as a bug Pokémon, it lowers the guard of actual bug Pokémon lured in by a scent of sweet flowers. Its sickles bring them down.
descriptionY: A lot of time and effort is required to maintain the vivid colors of its petals. This Pokémon puts its Trainer’s attentiveness to the test.

name: Morelull
descriptionX: Pokémon living in the forest eat the delicious caps on Morelull’s head. The caps regrow overnight.
descriptionY: Morelull live in forests that stay dark even during the day. They scatter flickering spores that put enemies to sleep.

name: Shiinotic
descriptionX: Its flickering spores lure in prey and put them to sleep. Once this Pokémon has its prey snoozing, it drains their vitality with its fingertips.
descriptionY: If you see a light deep in a forest at night, don’t go near. Shiinotic will make you fall fast asleep.

name: Salandit
descriptionX: It taunts its prey and lures them into narrow, rocky areas where it then sprays them with toxic gas to make them dizzy and take them down.
descriptionY: Only female Salandit can produce gas laden with pheromones. Males entranced by this gas will do whatever the females tell them.

name: Salazzle
descriptionX: Salazzle makes its opponents light-headed with poisonous gas, then captivates them with alluring movements to turn them into loyal servants.
descriptionY: When two Salazzle meet, they will use their pheromone gas to fight over the males in each other’s group.

name: Stufful
descriptionX: Its fluffy fur is a delight to pet, but carelessly reaching out to touch this Pokémon could result in painful retaliation.
descriptionY: The way it protects itself by flailing its arms may be an adorable sight, but stay well away. This is flailing that can snap thick tree trunks.

name: Bewear
descriptionX: Once it accepts you as a friend, it tries to show its affection with a hug. Letting it do that is dangerous—it could easily shatter your bones.
descriptionY: The moves it uses to take down its prey would make a martial artist jealous. It tucks subdued prey under its arms to carry them to its nest.

name: Bounsweet
descriptionX: Its sweat is sweet, like syrup made from boiled-down fruit. Because of this, Bounsweet was highly valued in the past, when sweeteners were scarce.
descriptionY: A Greedent drawn in by the sweet scent of these Pokémon will tuck the Bounsweet in among the berries in its tail and carry them all away.

name: Steenee
descriptionX: Steenee spreads a sweet scent that makes others feel invigorated. This same scent is popular for antiperspirants.
descriptionY: Steenee bounces energetically through forests. If the rind that peels off its body is pulverized, it can be used to treat stomach pains.

name: Tsareena
descriptionX: This Pokémon is proud and aggressive. However, it is said that a Tsareena will instantly become calm if someone touches the crown on its calyx.
descriptionY: This Pokémon launches fierce yet elegant kicks with its long, slender legs. It views Quaquaval as its rival.

name: Comfey
descriptionX: Comfey picks flowers with its vine and decorates itself with them. For some reason, flowers won’t wither once they’re attached to a Comfey.
descriptionY: These Pokémon smell very nice. All Comfey wear different flowers, so each of these Pokémon has its own individual scent.

name: Oranguru
descriptionX: People used to mistake Oranguru for a human when they saw it issue command after command to the other Pokémon of the forest.
descriptionY: This Pokémon lives quietly in the depths of the forest. The purple, cape-like fur gets longer and longer as Oranguru ages.

name: Passimian
descriptionX: This Pokémon battles by throwing hard berries. It won’t obey a Trainer who throws Poké Balls without skill.
descriptionY: The boss chooses 10 members of the group to go out hunting. The hunting party will evenly split the food they find with the rest of the group.

name: Wimpod
descriptionX: It’s nature’s cleaner—it eats anything and everything, including garbage and rotten things. The ground near its nest is always clean.
descriptionY: Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the lookout for danger. They scatter the moment they detect an enemy’s presence.

name: Golisopod
descriptionX: It will do anything to win, taking advantage of every opening and finishing opponents off with the small claws on its front legs.
descriptionY: They live in sunken ships or in holes in the seabed. When Golisopod and Grapploct battle, the loser becomes the winner’s meal.

name: Sandygast
descriptionX: If it loses its shovel, it will stick something else—like a branch—in its head to make do until it finds another shovel.
descriptionY: It flings sand into the eyes of its prey and tries to close in on them while they’re blinded, but since Sandygast is so slow, the prey tends to escape.

name: Palossand
descriptionX: The terrifying Palossand drags smaller Pokémon into its sandy body. Once its victims are trapped, it drains them of their vitality whenever it pleases.
descriptionY: From the hollows in its arms, it fires the bones of its victims, which are all dried up after being drained of their vitality.

name: Pyukumuku
descriptionX: It lives in warm, shallow waters. If it encounters a foe, it will spit out its internal organs as a means to punch them.
descriptionY: It’s covered in a slime that keeps its skin moist, allowing it to stay on land for days without drying up.

name: Type: Null
descriptionX: Rumor has it that the theft of top-secret research notes led to a new instance of this Pokémon being created in the Galar region.
descriptionY: It was modeled after a mighty Pokémon of myth. The mask placed upon it limits its power in order to keep it under control.

name: Silvally
descriptionX: A solid bond of trust between this Pokémon and its Trainer awakened the strength hidden within Silvally. It can change its type at will.
descriptionY: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

name: Meteor Form
descriptionX: It lives in the ozone layer, where it becomes food for stronger Pokémon. When it tries to run away, it falls to the ground.
descriptionY: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.

name: Red Core
descriptionX: Places where Minior fall from the night sky are few and far between, with Alola being one of the precious few.
descriptionY: This is its form when its shell has fallen off. The color of its core depends on the materials that made up the food it ate.

name: Komala
descriptionX: Komala spends its entire life sleeping. It feeds on leaves that contain a potent poison only Komala can break down.
descriptionY: A potent anesthetic can be made by diluting Komala’s drool. This anesthetic was used for surgeries in the past.

name: Turtonator
descriptionX: Explosive substances coat the shell on its back. Enemies that dare attack it will be blown away by an immense detonation.
descriptionY: Eating sulfur in its volcanic habitat is what causes explosive compounds to develop in its shell. Its droppings are also dangerously explosive.

name: Togedemaru
descriptionX: With the long hairs on its back, this Pokémon takes in electricity from other electric Pokémon. It stores what it absorbs in an electric sac.
descriptionY: When it’s in trouble, it curls up into a ball, makes its fur spikes stand on end, and then discharges electricity indiscriminately.

name: Mimikyu
descriptionX: This Pokémon lives in dark places untouched by sunlight. When it appears before humans, it hides itself under a cloth that resembles a Pikachu.
descriptionY: Mimikyu was only recently identified as a Pokémon. Previously, people thought it was just a ghost wearing a cloth.

name: Bruxish
descriptionX: It grinds its teeth with great force to stimulate its brain. It fires the psychic energy created by this process from the protuberance on its head.
descriptionY: When sunlight reflects on the ripples created by a Bruxish grinding its teeth, the water all around sparkles brilliantly.

name: Drampa
descriptionX: The mountains it calls home are nearly two miles in height. On rare occasions, it descends to play with the children living in the towns below.
descriptionY: Drampa is a kind and friendly Pokémon—up until it’s angered. When that happens, it stirs up a gale and flattens everything around.

name: Dhelmise
descriptionX: After a piece of seaweed merged with debris from a sunken ship, it was reborn as this ghost Pokémon.
descriptionY: After lowering its anchor, it waits for its prey. It catches large Wailord and drains their life-force.

name: Jangmo-o
descriptionX: They learn to fight by smashing their head scales together. The dueling strengthens both their skills and their spirits.
descriptionY: Jangmo-o strikes its scales to communicate with others of its kind. Its scales are actually fur that’s become as hard as metal.

name: Hakamo-o
descriptionX: The scaleless, scarred parts of its body are signs of its strength. It shows them off to defeated opponents.
descriptionY: Before attacking its enemies, it clashes its scales together and roars. Its sharp claws shred the opposition.

name: Kommo-o
descriptionX: It clatters its tail scales to unnerve opponents. This Pokémon will battle only those who stand steadfast in the face of this display.
descriptionY: Certain ruins have paintings of ancient warriors wearing armor made of Kommo-o scales.

name: Tapu Koko
descriptionX: Although it’s called a guardian deity, if a person or Pokémon puts it in a bad mood, it will become a malevolent deity and attack.
descriptionY: The lightning-wielding guardian deity of Melemele, Tapu Koko is brimming with curiosity and appears before people from time to time.

name: Tapu Lele
descriptionX: It heals the wounds of people and Pokémon by sprinkling them with its sparkling scales. This guardian deity is worshiped on Akala.
descriptionY: Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and can be described as nature incarnate.

name: Tapu Bulu
descriptionX: Although it’s called a guardian deity, it’s violent enough to crush anyone it sees as an enemy.
descriptionY: It makes ringing sounds with its tail to let others know where it is, avoiding unneeded conflicts. This guardian deity of Ula’ula controls plants.

name: Tapu Fini
descriptionX: This guardian deity of Poni Island manipulates water. Because it lives deep within a thick fog, it came to be both feared and revered.
descriptionY: Although it’s called a guardian deity, terrible calamities sometimes befall those who recklessly approach Tapu Fini.

name: Cosmog
descriptionX: Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn’t seem to care.
descriptionY: Whether or not it’s a Pokémon from this world is a mystery. When it’s in a jam, it warps away to a safe place to hide.

name: Cosmoem
descriptionX: The king who ruled Alola in times of antiquity called it the “cocoon of the stars” and built an altar to worship it.
descriptionY: As it absorbs light, Cosmoem continues to grow. Its golden shell is surprisingly solid.

name: Solgaleo
descriptionX: Sometimes the result of its opening an Ultra Wormhole is that energy and life-forms from other worlds are called here to this world.
descriptionY: In writings from the distant past, it’s called by the name “the beast that devours the sun.”

name: Lunala
descriptionX: Records of it exist in writings from long, long ago, where it was known by the name “the beast that calls the moon.”
descriptionY: It sometimes summons unknown powers and life-forms here to this world from holes that lead to other worlds.

name: Nihilego
descriptionX: A life-form from another world, it was dubbed a UB and is thought to produce a strong neurotoxin.
descriptionY: It appeared in this world from an Ultra Wormhole. Nihilego appears to be a parasite that lives by feeding on people and Pokémon.

name: Buzzwole
descriptionX: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
descriptionY: Buzzwole goes around showing off its abnormally swollen muscles. It is one kind of Ultra Beast.

name: Pheromosa
descriptionX: A life-form that lives in another world, its body is thin and supple, but it also possesses great power.
descriptionY: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

name: Xurkitree
descriptionX: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
descriptionY: They’ve been dubbed Ultra Beasts. Some of them stand unmoving, like trees, with their arms and legs stuck into the ground.

name: Celesteela
descriptionX: One of the dangerous UBs, high energy readings can be detected coming from both of its huge arms.
descriptionY: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

name: Kartana
descriptionX: This Ultra Beast’s body, which is as thin as paper, is like a sharpened sword.
descriptionY: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

name: Guzzlord
descriptionX: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
descriptionY: An unknown life-form called a UB. It may be constantly hungry—it is certainly always devouring something.

name: Necrozma
descriptionX: It looks somehow pained as it rages around in search of light, which serves as its energy. It’s apparently from another world.
descriptionY: Light is the source of its energy. If it isn’t devouring light, impurities build up in it and on it, and Necrozma darkens and stops moving.

name: Dusk Mane
descriptionX: This is its form while it is devouring the light of Solgaleo. It pounces on foes and then slashes them with the claws on its four limbs and back.
descriptionY: This is Necrozma’s form while it’s absorbing the power of Solgaleo, making it extremely ferocious and impossible to control.

name: Dawn Wings
descriptionX: Lunala no longer has a will of its own. Now under the control of Necrozma, it continuously expels all of its energy.
descriptionY: This is its form while it’s devouring the light of Lunala. It grasps foes in its giant claws and rips them apart with brute force.

name: Ultra Necrozma
descriptionX: This is its form when it has absorbed overwhelming light energy. It fires laser beams from all over its body.
descriptionY: The light pouring out from all over its body affects living things and nature, impacting them in various ways.

name: Magearna
descriptionX: It synchronizes its consciousness with others to understand their feelings. This faculty makes it useful for taking care of people.
descriptionY: Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist, the part called the Soul-Heart is the actual life-form.

name: Marshadow
descriptionX: It slips into the shadows of others and mimics their powers and movements. As it improves, it becomes stronger than those it’s imitating.
descriptionY: It sinks into the shadows of people and Pokémon, where it can understand their feelings and copy their capabilities.

name: Poipole
descriptionX: This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.
descriptionY: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.

name: Naganadel
descriptionX: It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid inside its body. It is one of the organisms known as UBs.
descriptionY: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.

name: Stakataka
descriptionX: It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one appears to be made up of many life-forms stacked one on top of each other.
descriptionY: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the brute’s true identity was this mysterious life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.

name: Blacephalon
descriptionX: It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It’s apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.
descriptionY: A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it causes explosions, then takes advantage of opponents’ surprise to rob them of their vitality.

name: Zeraora
descriptionX: It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack, they’ll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.
descriptionY: It approaches its enemies at the speed of lightning, then tears them limb from limb with its sharp claws.

name: Meltan
descriptionX: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.
descriptionY: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.

name: Melmetal
descriptionX: At the end of its life-span, Melmetal will rust and fall apart. The small shards left behind will eventually be reborn as Meltan.
descriptionY: Centrifugal force is behind the punches of Melmetal’s heavy hex-nut arms. Melmetal is said to deliver the strongest punches of all Pokémon.

name: Gigantamax Melmetal
descriptionX: In a distant land, there are legends about a cyclopean giant. In fact, the giant was a Melmetal that was flooded with Gigantamax energy.
descriptionY: It can send electric beams streaking out from the hole in its belly. The beams’ tremendous energy can vaporize an opponent in one shot.

name: Grookey
descriptionX: When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.
descriptionY: It attacks with rapid beats of its stick. As it strikes with amazing speed, it gets more and more pumped.

name: Thwackey
descriptionX: The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.
descriptionY: When it’s drumming out rapid beats in battle, it gets so caught up in the rhythm that it won’t even notice that it’s already knocked out its opponent.

name: Rillaboom
descriptionX: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.
descriptionY: The one with the best drumming techniques becomes the boss of the troop. It has a gentle disposition and values harmony among its group.

name: Gigantamax Rillaboom
descriptionX: Gigantamax energy has caused Rillaboom’s stump to grow into a drum set that resembles a forest.
descriptionY: Rillaboom has become one with its forest of drums and continues to lay down beats that shake all of Galar.

name: Scorbunny
descriptionX: A warm-up of running around gets fire energy coursing through this Pokémon’s body. Once that happens, it’s ready to fight at full power.
descriptionY: It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and one on its nose. Once it’s raring to fight, these pads radiate tremendous heat.

name: Raboot
descriptionX: Its thick and fluffy fur protects it from the cold and enables it to use hotter fire moves.
descriptionY: It kicks berries right off the branches of trees and then juggles them with its feet, practicing its footwork.

name: Cinderace
descriptionX: It juggles a pebble with its feet, turning it into a burning soccer ball. Its shots strike opponents hard and leave them scorched.
descriptionY: It’s skilled at both offense and defense, and it gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.

name: Gigantamax Cinderace
descriptionX: Infused with Cinderace’s fighting spirit, the gigantic Pyro Ball never misses its targets and completely roasts opponents.
descriptionY: Gigantamax energy can sometimes cause the diameter of this Pokémon’s fireball to exceed 300 feet.

name: Sobble
descriptionX: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won’t be able to resist weeping.
descriptionY: When it gets wet, its skin changes color, and this Pokémon becomes invisible as if it were camouflaged.

name: Drizzile
descriptionX: A clever combatant, this Pokémon battles using water balloons created with moisture secreted from its palms.
descriptionY: Highly intelligent but also very lazy, it keeps enemies out of its territory by laying traps everywhere.

name: Inteleon
descriptionX: It has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips that can shoot water and a membrane on its back that it can use to glide through the air.
descriptionY: Its nictitating membranes let it pick out foes’ weak points so it can precisely blast them with water that shoots from its fingertips at Mach 3.

name: Gigantamax Inteleon
descriptionX: Gigantamax Inteleon’s Water Gun move fires at Mach 7. As the Pokémon takes aim, it uses the crest on its head to gauge wind and temperature.
descriptionY: It has excellent sniping skills. Shooting a berry rolling along over nine miles away is a piece of cake for this Pokémon.

name: Skwovet
descriptionX: It stores berries in its cheeks. When there are no berries to be found, Skwovet will stuff pebbles into its cheeks to stave off its cravings.
descriptionY: No matter how much it stuffs its belly with food, it is always anxious about getting hungry again. So, it stashes berries in its cheeks and tail.

name: Greedent
descriptionX: If it spots a berry tree, it will immediately go to gather berries without a sideways glance—even if it’s in the middle of a battle.
descriptionY: This Pokémon makes off with heaps of fallen berries by wrapping them in its tail, which is roughly twice the length of its body.

name: Rookidee
descriptionX: This Pokémon is brave and reckless. The white markings around a Rookidee’s eyes intimidate fainthearted Pokémon.
descriptionY: The females are fussier than the males. If another creature dirties a female Rookidee’s wings, it’ll peck the offender relentlessly in a burning rage.

name: Corvisquire
descriptionX: It’s said that the reason behind Corvisquire’s high level of intelligence is the large size of its brain relative to those of other bird Pokémon.
descriptionY: This intelligent Pokémon will quickly learn how to use any tool it can hold in its beak or its talons.

name: Corviknight
descriptionX: Corviknight can’t serve as a taxi service in Paldea because the Pokémon’s natural predators will attack it while it flies, endangering the customer.
descriptionY: Although its wings have partly turned to steel and become heavy as a result, this Pokémon flies through the skies with ease.

name: Gigantamax Corviknight
descriptionX: Imbued with Gigantamax energy, its wings can whip up winds more forceful than any a hurricane could muster. The gusts blow everything away.
descriptionY: The eight feathers on its back are called blade birds, and they can launch off its body to attack foes independently.

name: Blipbug
descriptionX: A constant collector of information, this Pokémon is very smart. Very strong is what it isn’t.
descriptionY: Often found in gardens, this Pokémon has hairs on its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.

name: Dottler
descriptionX: It barely moves, but it’s still alive. Hiding in its shell without food or water seems to have awakened its psychic powers.
descriptionY: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.

name: Orbeetle
descriptionX: It’s famous for its high level of intelligence, and the large size of its brain is proof that it also possesses immense psychic power.
descriptionY: It emits psychic energy to observe and study what’s around it—and what’s around it can include things over six miles away.

name: Gigantamax Orbeetle
descriptionX: Its brain has grown to a gargantuan size, as has the rest of its body. This Pokémon’s intellect and psychic abilities are overpowering.
descriptionY: If it were to utilize every last bit of its power, it could control the minds of every living being in its vicinity.

name: Nickit
descriptionX: Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.
descriptionY: Cunning and cautious, this Pokémon survives by stealing food from others. It erases its tracks with swipes of its tail as it makes off with its plunder.

name: Thievul
descriptionX: It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.
descriptionY: With a lithe body and sharp claws, it goes around stealing food and eggs. Boltund is its natural enemy.

name: Gossifleur
descriptionX: It anchors itself in the ground with its single leg, then basks in the sun. After absorbing enough sunlight, its petals spread as it blooms brilliantly.
descriptionY: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.

name: Eldegoss
descriptionX: The seeds attached to its cotton fluff are full of nutrients. It spreads them on the wind so that plants and other Pokémon can benefit from them.
descriptionY: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.

name: Wooloo
descriptionX: Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.
descriptionY: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won’t be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokémon is surprisingly strong.

name: Dubwool
descriptionX: Weave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end up with something closer to a trampoline. You’ll start to bounce the moment you set foot on it.
descriptionY: Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the opposite gender. They never see use in battle.

name: Chewtle
descriptionX: Its large front tooth is still growing in. When the tooth itches, this Pokémon will bite another Chewtle’s horn, and the two Pokémon will tussle.
descriptionY: A popular game among children is to lift up sticks that Chewtle have bitten onto to see whose Chewtle can hang on the longest.

name: Drednaw
descriptionX: Its massive, jagged teeth can crush a boulder in a single bite. This Pokémon has an extremely vicious disposition.
descriptionY: Drednaw lurks along the shoreline. When prey come to drink water, Drednaw stretches its neck out and chomps down on them.

name: Gigantamax Drednaw
descriptionX: It responded to Gigantamax energy by becoming bipedal. First it comes crashing down on foes, and then it finishes them off with its massive jaws.
descriptionY: In the Galar region, there’s a tale about this Pokémon chewing up a mountain and using the rubble to stop a flood.

name: Yamper
descriptionX: This Pokémon is very popular as a herding dog in the Galar region. As it runs, it generates electricity from the base of its tail.
descriptionY: This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.

name: Boltund
descriptionX: This Pokémon generates electricity and channels it into its legs to keep them going strong. Boltund can run nonstop for three full days.
descriptionY: It sends electricity through its legs to boost their strength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks 50 mph.

name: Rolycoly
descriptionX: On sunny days, Rolycoly will come out onto grassy plains and roll around. Then it will eat the grass that gets tangled in its wheel-like leg.
descriptionY: Chunks of the surface of this Pokémon’s body that have grown old and flaked off have long been used for fuel as an alternative to coal.

name: Carkol
descriptionX: The temperature inside its body increases when it experiences strong emotions. It rolls around frantically while spewing flames.
descriptionY: Due to the coal tar created inside it, the heap of coal on Carkol’s back never falls apart, even when the Pokémon rolls around at high speeds.

name: Coalossal
descriptionX: To intimidate its opponents, Coalossal will vigorously shake its body, scattering coal from its smoldering back.
descriptionY: It’s gentle usually but fearsome when angered. With a body that burns at over 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit, it crushes foes and turns them to ash.

name: Gigantamax Coalossal
descriptionX: Its body is a colossal stove. With Gigantamax energy stoking the fire, this Pokémon’s flame burns hotter than 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
descriptionY: When Galar was hit by a harsh cold wave, this Pokémon served as a giant heating stove and saved many lives.

name: Applin
descriptionX: It grows by eating the flesh of an apple. Applin uses its own body fluid to strengthen the apple’s skin and prevent it from rotting.
descriptionY: Applin lives inside an apple. When an Applin is separated from its apple, its body loses moisture and the Pokémon grows weak.

name: Flapple
descriptionX: It flutters around while seeking an opening in the opponent’s guard, then attacks by spitting acidic liquid strong enough to melt metal.
descriptionY: It uses its own body fluid to repair its apple. Strong Flapple that have won many battles have apples that are clay colored all over.

name: Gigantamax Flapple
descriptionX: Under the influence of Gigantamax energy, it produces much more sweet nectar, and its shape has changed to resemble a giant apple.
descriptionY: If it stretches its neck, the strong aroma of its nectar pours out. The scent is so sickeningly sweet that one whiff makes other Pokémon faint.

name: Appletun
descriptionX: It feeds mainly on sweet apples. It will also eat small bug Pokémon that are attracted by its sweet nectar.
descriptionY: When some Lechonk come along to lick the sweet nectar on Appletun’s back, Appletun will spew sticky nectar at them to drive them away.

name: Gigantamax Appletun
descriptionX: It blasts its opponents with massive amounts of sweet, sticky nectar, drowning them under the deluge.
descriptionY: Due to Gigantamax energy, this Pokémon’s nectar has thickened. The increased viscosity lets the nectar absorb more damage than before.

name: Silicobra
descriptionX: Silicobra’s neck pouch, which can inflate and deflate like a balloon, gets more elastic each time Silicobra sheds its skin.
descriptionY: Silicobra’s large nostrils are specialized for spraying sand, so this Pokémon is not very good at telling apart different smells.

name: Sandaconda
descriptionX: It will expand its body as much as it can and then contract itself, blasting out sand with enough force to wash away a dump truck.
descriptionY: The sand it spews contains sharp, pointy gravel, which is actually just sand that Sandaconda’s saliva has hardened into irregular shapes.

name: Gigantamax Sandaconda
descriptionX: Its sand pouch has grown to tremendous proportions. More than 1,000,000 tons of sand now swirl around its body.
descriptionY: Sand swirls around its body with such speed and power that it could pulverize a skyscraper.

name: Cramorant
descriptionX: It’s so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it’s battling midfight.
descriptionY: This hungry Pokémon swallows Arrokuda whole. Occasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to swallow a Pokémon other than its preferred prey.

name: Arrokuda
descriptionX: Arrokuda can swim quickly only in a straight line. The ones that become sluggish from overeating are the first to be targeted by flocks of Wattrel.
descriptionY: It takes down prey by charging into them with its hard, pointed jaw. But Arrokuda’s eyesight is poor, so this tactic has a low success rate.

name: Barraskewda
descriptionX: It spins its tail fins to leap from the water, then viciously bites down on Wingull flying close to the water’s surface.
descriptionY: It swims at speeds of over 100 knots and battles fiercely with pods of Finizen over prey.

name: Toxel
descriptionX: It has no problem drinking dirty water. An organ inside Toxel’s body filters such water into a poisonous liquid that is harmless to Toxel.
descriptionY: This selfish, attention-seeking Pokémon stores poison and electricity in two different sacs inside its body.

name: Low Key Form Toxtricity
descriptionX: Many youths admire the way this Pokémon listlessly picks fights and keeps its cool no matter what opponent it faces.
descriptionY: As it gulps down stagnant water and generates electricity in its body, a sound like a rhythm played by a bass guitar reverberates all around.

name: Amped Form Toxtricity
descriptionX: As it scatters toxic sweat and emits electricity, a melody that sounds like it came from a guitar reverberates through the surrounding area.
descriptionY: The jolts of electricity it launches by violently strumming the protrusions on its chest easily exceed 15,000 volts.

name: Gigantamax Toxtricity
descriptionX: Its excessive electric energy is its weapon. This Pokémon can build up more electricity than any thundercloud.
descriptionY: Out of control after its own poison penetrated its brain, it tears across the land in a rampage, contaminating the earth with toxic sweat.

name: Sizzlipede
descriptionX: It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.
descriptionY: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they’re well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.

name: Centiskorch
descriptionX: When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.
descriptionY: While its burning body is already dangerous on its own, this excessively hostile Pokémon also has large and very sharp fangs.

name: Gigantamax Centiskorch
descriptionX: Gigantamax energy has evoked a rise in its body temperature, now reaching over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. Its heat waves incinerate its enemies.
descriptionY: The heat that comes off a Gigantamax Centiskorch may destabilize air currents. Sometimes it can even cause storms.

name: Clobbopus
descriptionX: It’s very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.
descriptionY: Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isn’t alarmed when that happens—it knows they’ll grow back. It’s about as smart as a three-year-old.

name: Grapploct
descriptionX: A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.
descriptionY: Searching for an opponent to test its skills against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle is over, it returns to the sea.

name: Sinistea
descriptionX: The soul of someone who died alone possessed some leftover tea. This Pokémon appears in hotels and houses.
descriptionY: Sinistea gets into your body when you drink it, and then it steals your vitality from within. It also tastes awful.

name: Polteageist
descriptionX: The tea that composes Polteageist’s body has a distinct and enjoyable flavor. Drinking too much, however, can be fatal.
descriptionY: These Pokémon multiply by creeping into teapots and pouring themselves into leftover tea.

name: Hatenna
descriptionX: Because the emotions of others constantly flow into its head, this Pokémon prefers environments where no other creatures live.
descriptionY: It senses the feelings of other living creatures. Be careful not to expose it to strong emotions for too long, or it will end up exhausted.

name: Hattrem
descriptionX: To this Pokémon, strong emotions apparently feel like incredibly loud noises—even if the emotions are happy ones.
descriptionY: The moment this Pokémon finds someone who’s emitting strong emotions, it will pummel them senseless with its braids to silence them.

name: Hatterene
descriptionX: Hatterene knocks out those that intrude in its home forest by blasting them with a beam, then slashing with claws enhanced by psychic power.
descriptionY: Beware of forests that show no signs of living creatures within. You may have wandered into Hatterene’s territory.

name: Gigantamax Hatterene
descriptionX: This Pokémon can read the emotions of creatures over 30 miles away. The minute it senses hostility, it goes on the attack.
descriptionY: Beams like lightning shoot down from its tentacles. It’s known to some as the Raging Goddess.

name: Impidimp
descriptionX: The reason this Pokémon causes trouble for those it feels close to is because Impidimp itself gets irritable if it can’t absorb negative emotions.
descriptionY: They live in groups, pestering and playing pranks on each other to polish their troublemaking skills.

name: Morgrem
descriptionX: Morgrem prefers dirty tactics, like ambushing, because it doesn’t have confidence in its brawn.
descriptionY: This Pokémon absorbs negative emotions and turns them into energy. It’s popular with people who tend to think gloomy thoughts.

name: Grimmsnarl
descriptionX: This Pokémon has complete control over its hair. Grimmsnarl normally keeps its hair wrapped around its body to support its muscles.
descriptionY: It lives deep within the forest. Even after evolving into this splendid form, it hasn’t given up on its petty misdeeds and pranks.

name: Gigantamax Grimmsnarl
descriptionX: By transforming its leg hair, this Pokémon delivers power-packed drill kicks that can bore huge holes in Galar’s terrain.
descriptionY: Gigantamax energy has caused more hair to sprout all over its body. With the added strength, it can jump over the world’s tallest building.

name: Obstagoon
descriptionX: Its voice is staggering in volume. Obstagoon has a tendency to take on a threatening posture and shout—this move is known as Obstruct.
descriptionY: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.

name: Perrserker
descriptionX: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.
descriptionY: After many battles, it evolved dangerous claws that come together to form daggers when extended.

name: Cursola
descriptionX: Its shell is overflowing with its heightened otherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as protection for this Pokémon’s core spirit.
descriptionY: Be cautious of the ectoplasmic body surrounding its soul. You’ll become stiff as stone if you touch it.

name: Sirfetch’d
descriptionX: Only Farfetch’d that have survived many battles can attain this evolution. When this Pokémon’s leek withers, it will retire from combat.
descriptionY: After deflecting attacks with its hard leaf shield, it strikes back with its sharp leek stalk. The leek stalk is both weapon and food.

name: Mr. Rime
descriptionX: It’s highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane of ice in time with its graceful movements.
descriptionY: Its amusing movements make it very popular. It releases its psychic power from the pattern on its belly.

name: Runerigus
descriptionX: A powerful curse was woven into an ancient painting. After absorbing the spirit of a Yamask, the painting began to move.
descriptionY: Never touch its shadowlike body, or you’ll be shown the horrific memories behind the picture carved into it.

name: Milcery
descriptionX: This Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.
descriptionY: They say that any patisserie visited by Milcery is guaranteed success and good fortune.

name: Vanilla Cream Alcremie
descriptionX: When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to berries it’s decorated with cream.
descriptionY: When Alcremie is content, the cream it secretes from its hands becomes sweeter and richer.

name: Gigantamax Alcremie
descriptionX: Cream pours endlessly from this Pokémon’s body. The cream stiffens when compressed by an impact. A harder impact results in harder cream.
descriptionY: It launches swarms of missiles, each made of cream and loaded with 100,000 kilocalories. Get hit by one of these, and your head will swim.

name: Falinks
descriptionX: The brass, which is the one that stands at the front and issues orders, is the strongest and smartest of the six.
descriptionY: The leader, known as the brass, uses its extendible horn to issue orders to the others when it’s time to change formation.

name: Pincurchin
descriptionX: This Pokémon generates electricity when it digests food. It uses its five hard teeth to scrape seaweed off surfaces and eat it.
descriptionY: This Pokémon is so timid that even brushing against seaweed will make it discharge electricity in surprise. Its lips do not conduct electricity.

name: Snom
descriptionX: It eats snow that has accumulated on the ground. It prefers soft, freshly fallen snow, so it will eat its way up a mountain, aiming for the peak.
descriptionY: Within its internal organs, Snom amplifies the frigid air it gets from eating snow and then uses this amplified air to create icicle-like spikes.

name: Frosmoth
descriptionX: Frosmoth senses air currents with its antennae. It sends its scales drifting on frigid air, making them fall like snow.
descriptionY: It causes blizzards as it flies around with its huge, chill-emanating wings. Clean meltwater is its favorite thing to drink.

name: Stonjourner
descriptionX: The elemental composition of the rocks that form its body were found to match the bedrock of a land far away from this Pokémon’s habitat.
descriptionY: This Pokémon spends its life gazing at the setting sun. It strides leisurely across grassy plains on legs of rock that weigh over 400 pounds each.

name: Eiscue
descriptionX: On hot days, these Pokémon press their ice cube heads together and pass the time cooling each other down.
descriptionY: If you lick the ice covering its face, you’ll find it has a faintly salty taste. This species rode here on ocean currents from a cold, faraway land.

name: Male Indeedee
descriptionX: This Pokémon picks up on the positive emotions of other creatures via its horns and uses those emotions to fuel itself.
descriptionY: This Pokémon never leaves its Trainer’s side. It predicts their actions with its psychic power and takes care of their day-to-day needs.

name: Female Indeedee
descriptionX: It dislikes conflict. If a fight occurs in its territory, it uses psychic power to throw things at the combatants in an effort to drive them away.
descriptionY: In search of happy feelings—such as joy and gratitude—Indeedee bustles around, taking diligent care of people and other Pokémon.

name: Full Belly Mode Morpeko
descriptionX: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It’s also generating electricity.
descriptionY: It carries electrically roasted seeds with it as if they’re precious treasures. No matter how much it eats, it always gets hungry again in short order.

name: Hangry Mode Morpeko
descriptionX: Intense hunger drives it to extremes of violence, and the electricity in its cheek sacs has converted into a Dark-type energy.
descriptionY: Hunger hormones affect its temperament. Until its hunger is appeased, it gets up to all manner of evil deeds.

name: Cufant
descriptionX: Using the pointy tip of its trunk, it carves off chunks of hard rocks to eat. It is very docile and helps people with physical labor.
descriptionY: Cufant can lift loads weighing five tons. In the mornings, it heads into caves with its herd, in search of the ore on which these Pokémon feed.

name: Copperajah
descriptionX: This Pokémon was brought to Paldea long ago by people from a faraway land. It’s so strong that it can easily pull an airplane.
descriptionY: Copperajah are prideful, cantankerous Pokémon. Specimens with vibrant green skin command the respect of others of their kind.

name: Gigantamax Copperajah
descriptionX: So much power is packed within its trunk that if it were to unleash that power, the resulting blast could level mountains and change the landscape.
descriptionY: After this Pokémon has Gigantamaxed, its massive nose can utterly demolish large structures with a single smashing blow.

name: Dracozolt
descriptionX: In ancient times, it was unbeatable thanks to its powerful lower body, but it went extinct anyway after it depleted all its plant-based food sources.
descriptionY: The powerful muscles in its tail generate its electricity. Compared to its lower body, its upper half is entirely too small.

name: Arctozolt
descriptionX: The shaking of its freezing upper half is what generates its electricity. It has a hard time walking around.
descriptionY: This Pokémon lived on prehistoric seashores and was able to preserve food with the ice on its body. It went extinct because it moved so slowly.

name: Dracovish
descriptionX: Powerful legs and jaws made it the apex predator of its time. Its own overhunting of its prey was what drove it to extinction.
descriptionY: Its mighty legs are capable of running at speeds exceeding 40 mph, but this Pokémon can’t breathe unless it’s underwater.

name: Arctovish
descriptionX: Though it’s able to capture prey by freezing its surroundings, it has trouble eating the prey afterward because its mouth is on top of its head.
descriptionY: The skin on its face is impervious to attack, but breathing difficulties made this Pokémon go extinct anyway.

name: Duraludon
descriptionX: Its body resembles polished metal, and it’s both lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that it rusts easily.
descriptionY: The special metal that composes its body is very light, so this Pokémon has considerable agility. It lives in caves because it dislikes the rain.

name: Gigantamax Duraludon
descriptionX: It’s grown to resemble a skyscraper. Parts of its towering body glow due to a profusion of energy.
descriptionY: The hardness of its cells is exceptional, even among Steel types. It also has a body structure that’s resistant to earthquakes.

name: Dreepy
descriptionX: In the evening, groups of Dreepy will fly at high speeds over the ocean and poke at Pokémon in the water for fun.
descriptionY: It has a habit of biting at Clauncher even though it doesn’t feed on them. This is said to be vestigial behavior from when Dreepy was alive.

name: Drakloak
descriptionX: This Pokémon flies around at over 120 miles per hour. If a Drakloak is defeated in a battle, its Dreepy will wander off without a second thought.
descriptionY: This Pokémon stores up energy in its lungs, then shoots it out. It takes care of Dreepy and battles alongside them until they’re all grown up.

name: Dragapult
descriptionX: Dragapult can make its whole body transparent by clearing its mind and focusing. Even the Dreepy in Dragapult’s horns become invisible.
descriptionY: The fastest Dragapult of the group is always surrounded by Dreepy that want to fly at sonic speed.

name: Hero of Many Battles Zacian
descriptionX: Known as a legendary hero, this Pokémon absorbs metal particles, transforming them into a weapon it uses to battle.
descriptionY: This Pokémon has slumbered for many years. Some say it’s Zamazenta’s elder sister—others say the two Pokémon are rivals.

name: Crowned Sword Zacian
descriptionX: Now armed with a weapon it used in ancient times, this Pokémon needs only a single strike to fell even Gigantamax Pokémon.
descriptionY: Able to cut down anything with a single strike, it became known as the Fairy King’s Sword, and it inspired awe in friend and foe alike.

name: Hero of Many Battles Zamazenta
descriptionX: In times past, it worked together with a king of the people to save the Galar region. It absorbs metal that it then uses in battle.
descriptionY: This Pokémon slept for aeons while in the form of a statue. It was asleep for so long, people forgot that it ever existed.

name: Crowned Shield Zamazenta
descriptionX: Its ability to deflect any attack led to it being known as the Fighting Master’s Shield. It was feared and respected by all.
descriptionY: Now that it’s equipped with its shield, it can shrug off impressive blows, including the attacks of Dynamax Pokémon.

name: Eternatus
descriptionX: The core on its chest absorbs energy emanating from the lands of the Galar region. This energy is what allows Eternatus to stay active.
descriptionY: It was inside a meteorite that fell 20,000 years ago. There seems to be a connection between this Pokémon and the Dynamax phenomenon.

name: Kubfu
descriptionX: Kubfu trains hard to perfect its moves. The moves it masters will determine which form it takes when it evolves.
descriptionY: If Kubfu pulls the long white hair on its head, its fighting spirit heightens and power wells up from the depths of its belly.

name: Single Strike Style
descriptionX: This form of Urshifu is a strong believer in the one-hit KO. Its strategy is to leap in close to foes and land a devastating blow with a hardened fist.
descriptionY: Inhabiting the mountains of a distant region, this Pokémon races across sheer cliffs, training its legs and refining its moves.

name: Rapid Strike Style
descriptionX: It’s believed that this Pokémon modeled its fighting style on the flow of a river—sometimes rapid, sometimes calm.
descriptionY: This form of Urshifu is a strong believer in defeating foes by raining many blows down on them. Its strikes are nonstop, flowing like a river.

name: Gigantamax Urshifu (Single Strike Style)
descriptionX: People call it the embodiment of rage. It’s said that this Pokémon’s terrifying expression and shout will rid the world of malevolence.
descriptionY: The energy released by this Pokémon’s fists forms shock waves that can blow away Dynamax Pokémon in just one hit.

name: Gigantamax Urshifu (Rapid Strike Style)
descriptionX: As it waits for the right moment to unleash its Gigantamax power, this Pokémon maintains a perfect one-legged stance. It won’t even twitch.
descriptionY: All it takes is a glare from this Pokémon to take the lives of those with evil in their hearts—or so they say.

name: Zarude
descriptionX:
Within dense forests, this Pokémon lives in a pack
with others of its kind. It’s incredibly aggressive,
and the other Pokémon of the forest fear it.
descriptionY:
Once the vines on Zarude’s body tear off, they
become nutrients in the soil. This helps the plants
of the forest grow.

name: Regieleki
descriptionX: This Pokémon is a cluster of electrical energy. It’s said that removing the rings on Regieleki’s body will unleash the Pokémon’s latent power.
descriptionY: Its entire body is made up of a single organ that generates electrical energy. Regieleki is capable of creating all Galar’s electricity.

name: Regidrago
descriptionX: An academic theory proposes that Regidrago’s arms were once the head of an ancient dragon Pokémon. The theory remains unproven.
descriptionY: Its body is composed of crystallized dragon energy. Regidrago is said to have the powers of every dragon Pokémon.

name: Glastrier
descriptionX: Glastrier emits intense cold from its hooves. It’s also a belligerent Pokémon—anything it wants, it takes by force.
descriptionY: Glastrier has tremendous physical strength, and the mask of ice covering its face is 100 times harder than diamond.

name: Spectrier
descriptionX: It probes its surroundings with all its senses save one—it doesn’t use its sense of sight. Spectrier’s kicks are said to separate soul from body.
descriptionY: As it dashes through the night, Spectrier absorbs the life-force of sleeping creatures. It craves silence and solitude.

name: Calyrex
descriptionX: Calyrex is a merciful Pokémon, capable of providing healing and blessings. It reigned over the Galar region in times of yore.
descriptionY: Calyrex is known in legend as a king that ruled over Galar in ancient times. It has the power to cause hearts to mend and plants to spring forth.

name: Ice Rider Calyrex
descriptionX: According to lore, this Pokémon showed no mercy to those who got in its way, yet it would heal its opponents’ wounds after battle.
descriptionY: It’s said that this Pokémon once moved a large forest—and all the Pokémon living there—to a new location overnight.

name: Shadow Rider Calyrex
descriptionX: It’s said that Calyrex and a Pokémon that had bonded with it ran all across the Galar region to bring green to the wastelands.
descriptionY: Legend says that by using its power to see all events from past to future, this Pokémon saved the creatures of a forest from a meteorite strike.

name: Wyrdeer
descriptionX: The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the Pokémon is erecting invisible barriers. The fur shed from its beard retains heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.
descriptionY: The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the Pokémon is erecting invisible barriers. The fur shed from its beard retains heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.

name: Kleavor
descriptionX: A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone. If one should chance upon this Pokémon in the wilds, one’s only recourse is to flee.
descriptionY: A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone. If one should chance upon this Pokémon in the wilds, one’s only recourse is to flee.

name: Ursaluna
descriptionX: I believe it was Hisui’s swampy terrain that gave Ursaluna its burly physique and newfound capacity to manipulate peat at will.
descriptionY: I believe it was Hisui’s swampy terrain that gave Ursaluna its burly physique and newfound capacity to manipulate peat at will.

name: Male Basculegion
descriptionX: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui’s rivers is Basculegion’s equal.
descriptionY: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui’s rivers is Basculegion’s equal.

name: Female Basculegion
descriptionX: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui’s rivers is Basculegion’s equal.
