descriptionY: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui’s rivers is Basculegion’s equal.

name: Sneasler
descriptionX: Because of Sneasler’s virulent poison and daunting physical prowess, no other species could hope to best it on the frozen highlands. Preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.
descriptionY: Because of Sneasler’s virulent poison and daunting physical prowess, no other species could hope to best it on the frozen highlands. Preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.

name: Overqwil
descriptionX: Its lancelike spikes and savage temperament have earned it the nickname “sea fiend.” It slurps up poison to nourish itself.
descriptionY: Its lancelike spikes and savage temperament have earned it the nickname “sea fiend.” It slurps up poison to nourish itself.

name: Incarnate Forme Enamorus
descriptionX: When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémon’s love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.
descriptionY: When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémon’s love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.

name: Therian Forme Enamorus
descriptionX: A different guise from its feminine humanoid form. From the clouds, it descends upon those who treat any form of life with disrespect and metes out wrathful, ruthless punishment.
descriptionY: A different guise from its feminine humanoid form. From the clouds, it descends upon those who treat any form of life with disrespect and metes out wrathful, ruthless punishment.

name: Sprigatito
descriptionX: Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. This Pokémon frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.
descriptionY: The sweet scent its body gives off mesmerizes those around it. The scent grows stronger when this Pokémon is in the sun.

name: Floragato
descriptionX: Floragato deftly wields the vine hidden beneath its long fur, slamming the hard flower bud against its opponents.
descriptionY: The hardness of Floragato’s fur depends on the Pokémon’s mood. When Floragato is prepared to battle, its fur becomes pointed and needle sharp.

name: Meowscarada
descriptionX: This Pokémon uses the reflective fur lining its cape to camouflage the stem of its flower, creating the illusion that the flower is floating.
descriptionY: With skillful misdirection, it rigs foes with pollen-packed flower bombs. Meowscarada sets off the bombs before its foes realize what’s going on.

name: Fuecoco
descriptionX: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.
descriptionY: Its flame sac is small, so energy is always leaking out. This energy is released from the dent atop Fuecoco’s head and flickers to and fro.

name: Crocalor
descriptionX: The combination of Crocalor’s fire energy and overflowing vitality has caused an egg-shaped fireball to appear on the Pokémon’s head.
descriptionY: The valve in Crocalor’s flame sac is closely connected to its vocal cords. This Pokémon utters a guttural cry as it spews flames every which way.

name: Skeledirge
descriptionX: The fiery bird changes shape when Skeledirge sings. Rumor has it that the bird was born when the fireball on Skeledirge’s head gained a soul.
descriptionY: Skeledirge’s gentle singing soothes the souls of all that hear it. It burns its enemies to a crisp with flames of over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Quaxly
descriptionX: This Pokémon migrated to Paldea from distant lands long ago. The gel secreted by its feathers repels water and grime.
descriptionY: Its strong legs let it easily swim around in even fast-flowing rivers. It likes to keep things tidy and is prone to overthinking things.

name: Quaxwell
descriptionX: These Pokémon constantly run through shallow waters to train their legs, then compete with each other to see which of them kicks most gracefully.
descriptionY: The hardworking Quaxwell observes people and Pokémon from various regions and incorporates their movements into its own dance routines.

name: Quaquaval
descriptionX: A single kick from a Quaquaval can send a truck rolling. This Pokémon uses its powerful legs to perform striking dances from far-off lands.
descriptionY: Dancing in ways that evoke far-away places, this Pokémon mesmerizes all that see it. Flourishes of its decorative water feathers slice into its foes.

name: Lechonk
descriptionX: It searches for food all day. It possesses a keen sense of smell but doesn’t use it for anything other than foraging.
descriptionY: This Pokémon spurns all but the finest of foods. Its body gives off an herblike scent that bug Pokémon detest.

name: Male Oinkologne
descriptionX: Oinkologne is proud of its fine, glossy skin. It emits a concentrated scent from the tip of its tail.
descriptionY: It entrances female Pokémon with the sweet, alluring scent that wafts from all over its body.

name: Female Oinkologne
descriptionX: This Pokémon sends a flowerlike scent wafting about. Well-developed muscles in its legs allow it to leap more than 16 feet with no trouble at all.
descriptionY: This is a meticulous Pokémon that likes to keep things tidy. It shrouds itself in a floral aroma that soothes the Pokémon around it.

name: Tarountula
descriptionX: The ball of threads wrapped around its body is elastic enough to deflect the scythes of Scyther, this Pokémon’s natural enemy.
descriptionY: The thread it secretes from its rear is as strong as wire. The secret behind the thread’s strength is the topic of ongoing research.

name: Spidops
descriptionX: It clings to branches and ceilings using its threads and moves without a sound. It takes out its prey before the prey even notices it.
descriptionY: Spidops covers its territory in tough, sticky threads to set up traps for intruders.

name: Nymble
descriptionX: It has its third set of legs folded up. When it’s in a tough spot, this Pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.
descriptionY: It’s highly skilled at a fighting style in which it uses its jumping capabilities to dodge incoming attacks while also dealing damage to opponents.

name: Lokix
descriptionX: When it decides to fight all out, it stands on its previously folded legs to enter Showdown Mode. It neutralizes its enemies in short order.
descriptionY: It uses its normally folded third set of legs when in Showdown Mode. This places a huge burden on its body, so it can’t stay in this mode for long.

name: Pawmi
descriptionX: It has underdeveloped electric sacs on its cheeks. These sacs can produce electricity only if Pawmi rubs them furiously with the pads on its forepaws.
descriptionY: The pads of its paws are electricity-discharging organs. Pawmi fires electricity from its forepaws while standing unsteadily on its hind legs.

name: Pawmo
descriptionX: When its group is attacked, Pawmo is the first to leap into battle, defeating enemies with a fighting technique that utilizes electric shocks.
descriptionY: Pawmo uses a unique fighting technique in which it uses its forepaws to strike foes and zap them with electricity from its paw pads simultaneously.

name: Pawmot
descriptionX: This Pokémon normally is slow to react, but once it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies with lightning-fast movements.
descriptionY: Pawmot’s fluffy fur acts as a battery. It can store the same amount of electricity as an electric car.

name: Tandemaus
descriptionX: Exhibiting great teamwork, they use their incisors to cut pieces out of any material that might be useful for a nest, then make off with them.
descriptionY: The pair sticks together no matter what. They split any food they find exactly in half and then eat it together.

name: Maushold (Family of Four)
descriptionX: The two little ones just appeared one day. The group might be a family of related Pokémon, but nobody knows for sure.
descriptionY: The larger pair protects the little ones during battles. When facing strong opponents, the whole group will join the fight.

name: Maushold (Family of Three)
descriptionX: They build huge nests with many rooms that are used for different purposes, such as eating and sleeping.
descriptionY: The little one just appeared one day. They all live together like a family, but the relationship between the three is still unclear.

name: Fidough
descriptionX: This Pokémon is smooth and moist to the touch. Yeast in Fidough’s breath induces fermentation in the Pokémon’s vicinity.
descriptionY: The yeast in Fidough’s breath is useful for cooking, so this Pokémon has been protected by people since long ago.

name: Dachsbun
descriptionX: The pleasant aroma that emanates from this Pokémon’s body helps wheat grow, so Dachsbun has been treasured by farming villages.
descriptionY: The surface of this Pokémon’s skin hardens when exposed to intense heat, and its body has an appetizing aroma.

name: Smoliv
descriptionX: It protects itself from enemies by emitting oil from the fruit on its head. This oil is bitter and astringent enough to make someone flinch.
descriptionY: This Pokémon converts nutrients into oil, which it stores in the fruit on its head. It can easily go a whole week without eating or drinking.

name: Dolliv
descriptionX: Dolliv shares its tasty, fresh-scented oil with others. This species has coexisted with humans since times long gone.
descriptionY: It basks in the sun to its heart’s content until the fruits on its head ripen. After that, Dolliv departs from human settlements and goes on a journey.

name: Arboliva
descriptionX: This calm Pokémon is very compassionate. It will share its delicious, nutrient-rich oil with weakened Pokémon.
descriptionY: This Pokémon drives back enemies by launching its rich, aromatic oil at them with enough force to smash a boulder.

name: Green Plumage Squawkabilly
descriptionX: These Pokémon prefer to live in cities. They form flocks based on the color of their feathers, and they fight over territory.
descriptionY: Green-feathered flocks hold the most sway. When they’re out searching for food in the mornings and evenings, it gets very noisy.

name: Blue Plumage Squawkabilly
descriptionX: The largest of their flocks can contain more than 50 individuals. They fly around towns and forests, searching for food and making a racket.
descriptionY: Blue-feathered Squawkabilly view their green-feathered counterparts as rivals, since the latter make up the largest, most powerful groups.

name: Yellow Plumage Squawkabilly
descriptionX: These Squawkabilly are hotheaded, and their fighting style is vicious. They’ll leap within reach of their foes to engage in close combat.
descriptionY: The yellow Squawkabilly are especially fierce. They’ve even been known to drive other bird Pokémon out of town.

name: White Plumage Squawkabilly
descriptionX: This Pokémon dislikes being alone. It has a strong sense of community and survives by cooperating with allies.
descriptionY: Though these Squawkabilly are the fewest in number, they have no trouble living in towns since they blend in with the white buildings.

name: Nacli
descriptionX: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.
descriptionY: The ground scrapes its body as it travels, causing it to leave salt behind. Salt is constantly being created and replenished inside Nacli’s body.

name: Naclstack
descriptionX: This Pokémon dry cures its prey by spraying salt over them. The curing process steals away the water in the prey’s body.
descriptionY: It compresses rock salt inside its body and shoots out hardened salt pellets with enough force to perforate an iron sheet.

name: Garganacl
descriptionX: Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured Pokémon with salt. Even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.
descriptionY: Many Pokémon gather around Garganacl, hoping to lick at its mineral-rich salt.

name: Charcadet
descriptionX: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.
descriptionY: Its firepower increases when it fights, reaching over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. It likes berries that are rich in fat.

name: Armarouge
descriptionX: Armarouge evolved through the use of a set of armor that belonged to a distinguished warrior. This Pokémon is incredibly loyal.
descriptionY: This Pokémon clads itself in armor that has been fortified by psychic and fire energy, and it shoots blazing fireballs.

name: Ceruledge
descriptionX: The fiery blades on its arms burn fiercely with the lingering resentment of a sword wielder who fell before accomplishing their goal.
descriptionY: An old set of armor steeped in grudges caused this Pokémon’s evolution. Ceruledge cuts its enemies to pieces without mercy.

name: Tadbulb
descriptionX: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.
descriptionY: It floats using the electricity stored in its body. When thunderclouds are around, Tadbulb will float higher off the ground.

name: Bellibolt
descriptionX: When this Pokémon expands and contracts its wobbly body, the belly-button dynamo in its stomach produces a huge amount of electricity.
descriptionY: What appear to be eyeballs are actually organs for discharging the electricity generated by Bellibolt’s belly-button dynamo.

name: Wattrel
descriptionX: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokémon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.
descriptionY: These Pokémon make their nests on coastal cliffs. The nests have a strange, crackling texture, and they’re a popular delicacy.

name: Kilowattrel
descriptionX: Kilowattrel inflates its throat sac to amplify its electricity. By riding the wind, this Pokémon can fly over 430 miles in a day.
descriptionY: It uses its throat sac to store electricity generated by its wings. There’s hardly any oil in its feathers, so it is a poor swimmer.

name: Maschiff
descriptionX: It always scowls in an attempt to make opponents take it seriously, but even crying children will burst into laughter when they see Maschiff’s face.
descriptionY: Its well-developed jaw and fangs are strong enough to crunch through boulders, and its thick fat makes for an excellent defense.

name: Mabosstiff
descriptionX: This Pokémon can store energy in its large dewlap. Mabosstiff unleashes this energy all at once to blow away enemies.
descriptionY: Mabosstiff loves playing with children. Though usually gentle, it takes on an intimidating look when protecting its family.

name: Shroodle
descriptionX: Though usually a mellow Pokémon, it will sink its sharp, poison-soaked front teeth into any that anger it, causing paralysis in the object of its ire.
descriptionY: To keep enemies away from its territory, it paints markings around its nest using a poisonous liquid that has an acrid odor.

name: Grafaiai
descriptionX: The color of the poisonous saliva depends on what the Pokémon eats. Grafaiai covers its fingers in its saliva and draws patterns on trees in forests.
descriptionY: Each Grafaiai paints its own individual pattern, and it will paint that same pattern over and over again throughout its life.

name: Bramblin
descriptionX: A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a Pokémon.
descriptionY: Not even Bramblin knows where it is headed as it tumbles across the wilderness, blown by the wind. It loathes getting wet.

name: Brambleghast
descriptionX: It will open the branches of its head to envelop its prey. Once it absorbs all the life energy it needs, it expels the prey and discards it.
descriptionY: Brambleghast wanders around arid regions. On rare occasions, mass outbreaks of these Pokémon will bury an entire town.

name: Toedscool
descriptionX: Toedscool lives in muggy forests. The flaps that fall from its body are chewy and very delicious.
descriptionY: Though it looks like Tentacool, Toedscool is a completely different species. Its legs may be thin, but it can run at a speed of 30 mph.

name: Toedscruel
descriptionX: These Pokémon gather into groups and form colonies deep within forests. They absolutely hate it when strangers approach.
descriptionY: It coils its 10 tentacles around prey and sucks out their nutrients, causing the prey pain. The folds along the rim of its head are a popular delicacy.

name: Klawf
descriptionX: Klawf hangs upside-down from cliffs, waiting for prey. But Klawf can’t remain in this position for long because its blood rushes to its head.
descriptionY: This Pokémon lives on sheer cliffs. It sidesteps opponents’ attacks, then lunges for their weak spots with its claws.

name: Capsakid
descriptionX: The more sunlight this Pokémon bathes in, the more spicy chemicals are produced by its body, and thus the spicier its moves become.
descriptionY: Traditional Paldean dishes can be extremely spicy because they include the shed front teeth of Capsakid among their ingredients.

name: Scovillain
descriptionX: The red head converts spicy chemicals into fire energy and blasts the surrounding area with a super spicy stream of flame.
descriptionY: The green head has turned vicious due to the spicy chemicals stimulating its brain. Once it goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.

name: Rellor
descriptionX: This Pokémon creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. It treasures its mud ball more than its own life.
descriptionY: It rolls its mud ball around while the energy it needs for evolution matures. Eventually the time comes for it to evolve.

name: Rabsca
descriptionX: The body that supports the ball barely moves. Therefore, it is thought that the true body of this Pokémon is actually inside the ball.
descriptionY: An infant sleeps inside the ball. Rabsca rolls the ball soothingly with its legs to ensure the infant sleeps comfortably.

name: Flittle
descriptionX: Flittle’s toes levitate about half an inch above the ground because of the psychic power emitted from the frills on the Pokémon’s belly.
descriptionY: It spends its time running around wastelands. If anyone steals its beloved berries, it will chase them down and exact its revenge.

name: Espathra
descriptionX: It immobilizes opponents by bathing them in psychic power from its large eyes. Despite its appearance, it has a vicious temperament.
descriptionY: It emits psychic power from the gaps between its multicolored frills and sprints at speeds greater than 120 mph.

name: Tinkatink
descriptionX: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokémon that eat metal.
descriptionY: This Pokémon pounds iron scraps together to make a hammer. It will remake the hammer again and again until it’s satisfied with the result.

name: Tinkatuff
descriptionX: This Pokémon will attack groups of Pawniard and Bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.
descriptionY: These Pokémon make their homes in piles of scrap metal. They test the strength of each other’s hammers by smashing them together.

name: Tinkaton
descriptionX: This intelligent Pokémon has a very daring disposition. It knocks rocks into the sky with its hammer, aiming for flying Corviknight.
descriptionY: The hammer tops 220 pounds, yet it gets swung around easily by Tinkaton as it steals whatever it pleases and carries its plunder back home.

name: Wiglett
descriptionX: This Pokémon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.
descriptionY: Though it looks like Diglett, Wiglett is an entirely different species. The resemblance seems to be a coincidental result of environmental adaptation.

name: Wugtrio
descriptionX: It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.
descriptionY: A variety of fish Pokémon, Wugtrio was once considered to be a regional form of Dugtrio.

name: Bombirdier
descriptionX: It gathers things up in an apron made from shed feathers added to the Pokémon’s chest feathers, then drops those things from high places for fun.
descriptionY: Bombirdier uses the apron on its chest to bundle up food, which it carries back to its nest. It enjoys dropping things that make loud noises.

name: Finizen
descriptionX: It likes playing with others of its kind using the water ring on its tail. It uses ultrasonic waves to sense the emotions of other living creatures.
descriptionY: Its water ring is made from seawater mixed with a sticky fluid that Finizen secretes from its blowhole.

name: Zero Form Palafin
descriptionX: This Pokémon changes its appearance if it hears its allies calling for help. Palafin will never show anybody its moment of transformation.
descriptionY: Its physical capabilities are no different than a Finizen’s, but when its allies are in danger, it transforms and powers itself up.

name: Hero Form Palafin
descriptionX: This Pokémon’s ancient genes have awakened. It is now so extraordinarily strong that it can easily lift a cruise ship with one fin.
descriptionY: This hero of the ocean swims at a speed of 50 knots and saves drowning people and Pokémon.

name: Varoom
descriptionX: It is said that this Pokémon was born when an unknown poison Pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.
descriptionY: The steel section is Varoom’s actual body. This Pokémon clings to rocks and converts the minerals within into energy to fuel its activities.

name: Revavroom
descriptionX: It creates a gas out of poison and minerals from rocks. It then detonates the gas in its cylinders—now numbering eight—to generate energy.
descriptionY: Revavroom viciously threatens others with the sound of its exhaust. It sticks its tongue out from its cylindrical mouth and sprays toxic fluids.

name: Cyclizar
descriptionX: Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.
descriptionY: It can sprint at over 70 mph while carrying a human. The rider’s body heat warms Cyclizar’s back and lifts the Pokémon’s spirit.

name: Orthworm
descriptionX: When attacked, this Pokémon will wield the tendrils on its body like fists and pelt the opponent with a storm of punches.
descriptionY: This Pokémon lives in arid deserts. It maintains its metal body by consuming iron from the soil.

name: Glimmet
descriptionX: It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.
descriptionY: Glimmet’s toxic mineral crystals look just like flower petals. This Pokémon scatters poisonous powder like pollen to protect itself.

name: Glimmora
descriptionX: When this Pokémon detects danger, it will open up its crystalline petals and fire beams from its conical body.
descriptionY: Glimmora’s petals are made of crystallized poison energy. It has recently become evident that these petals resemble Tera Jewels.

name: Greavard
descriptionX: It is said that a dog Pokémon that died in the wild without ever interacting with a human was reborn as this Pokémon.
descriptionY: This friendly Pokémon doesn’t like being alone. Pay it even the slightest bit of attention, and it will follow you forever.

name: Houndstone
descriptionX: Houndstone spends most of its time sleeping in graveyards. Among all the dog Pokémon, this one is most loyal to its master.
descriptionY: A lovingly mourned Pokémon was reborn as Houndstone. It doesn’t like anyone touching the protuberance atop its head.

name: Flamigo
descriptionX: This Pokémon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.
descriptionY: Thanks to a behavior of theirs known as “synchronizing,” an entire flock of these Pokémon can attack simultaneously in perfect harmony.

name: Cetoddle
descriptionX: This species left the ocean and began living on land a very long time ago. It seems to be closely related to Wailmer.
descriptionY: It lives in frigid regions in pods of five or so individuals. It loves the minerals found in snow and ice.

name: Cetitan
descriptionX: This Pokémon wanders around snowy, icy areas. It protects its body with powerful muscles and a thick layer of fat under its skin.
descriptionY: Ice energy builds up in the horn on its upper jaw, causing the horn to reach cryogenic temperatures that freeze its surroundings.

name: Veluza
descriptionX: When Veluza discards unnecessary flesh, its mind becomes honed and its psychic power increases. The spare flesh has a mild but delicious flavor.
descriptionY: Veluza has excellent regenerative capabilities. It sheds spare flesh from its body to boost its agility, then charges at its prey.

name: Dondozo
descriptionX: This Pokémon is a glutton, but it’s bad at getting food. It teams up with a Tatsugiri to catch prey.
descriptionY: It treats Tatsugiri like its boss and follows it loyally. Though powerful, Dondozo is apparently not very smart.

name: Curly Form Tatsugiri
descriptionX: This is a small dragon Pokémon. It lives inside the mouth of Dondozo to protect itself from enemies on the outside.
descriptionY: Tatsugiri is an extremely cunning Pokémon. It feigns weakness to lure in prey, then orders its partner to attack.

name: Droopy Form Tatsugiri
descriptionX: This species’ differing colors and patterns are apparently the result of Tatsugiri changing itself to suit the preferences of the prey it lures in.
descriptionY: This Pokémon tricks its opponents by playing dead. It is small and weak, but it uses its smarts to survive.

name: Stretchy Form Tatsugiri
descriptionX: Bird Pokémon are its main prey. This Pokémon knows it’s weak, so it hunts with a partner.
descriptionY: It’s one of the most intelligent dragon Pokémon. It camouflages itself by inflating its throat sac.

name: Annihilape
descriptionX: When its anger rose beyond a critical point, this Pokémon gained power that is unfettered by the limits of its physical body.
descriptionY: It imbues its fists with the power of the rage that it kept hidden in its heart. Opponents struck by these imbued fists will be shattered to their core.

name: Clodsire
descriptionX: When attacked, this Pokémon will retaliate by sticking thick spines out from its body. It’s a risky move that puts everything on the line.
descriptionY: It lives at the bottom of ponds and swamps. It will carry Wooper on its back and ferry them across water from one shore to the other.

name: Farigiraf
descriptionX: Now that the brain waves from the head and tail are synced up, the psychic power of this Pokémon is 10 times stronger than Girafarig’s.
descriptionY: The hardened head from the tail protects the head of the main body as Farigiraf whips its long neck around to headbutt enemies.

name: Two-Segment Form Dudunsparce
descriptionX: This Pokémon uses its hard tail to make its nest by boring holes into bedrock deep underground. The nest can reach lengths of over six miles.
descriptionY: It drives enemies out of its nest by sucking in enough air to fill its long, narrow lungs, then releasing the air in an intense blast.

name: Three-Segment Form Dudunsparce
descriptionX: The gentle Dudunsparce will put Pokémon that wander into its nest onto its back and carry them to the entrance.
descriptionY: A recent study uncovered that the number of segments a Dudunsparce’s body has is determined by the Pokémon’s genes.

name: Kingambit
descriptionX: Only a Bisharp that stands above all others in its vast army can evolve into Kingambit.
descriptionY: Though it commands a massive army in battle, it’s not skilled at devising complex strategies. It just uses brute strength to keep pushing.

name: Great Tusk
descriptionX: Sightings of this Pokémon have occurred in recent years. The name Great Tusk was taken from a creature listed in a certain book.
descriptionY: This creature resembles a mysterious Pokémon that, according to a paranormal magazine, has lived since ancient times.

name: Scream Tail
descriptionX: There has been only one reported sighting of this Pokémon. It resembles a mysterious creature depicted in an old expedition journal.
descriptionY: It resembles a mysterious Pokémon described in a paranormal magazine as a Jigglypuff from one billion years ago.

name: Brute Bonnet
descriptionX: It is possible that the creature listed as Brute Bonnet in a certain book could actually be this Pokémon.
descriptionY: It bears a slight resemblance to a Pokémon described in a dubious magazine as a cross between a dinosaur and a mushroom.

name: Flutter Mane
descriptionX: This Pokémon has characteristics similar to those of Flutter Mane, a creature mentioned in a certain book.
descriptionY: It has similar features to a ghostly pterosaur that was covered in a paranormal magazine, but the two have little else in common.

name: Slither Wing
descriptionX: This mysterious Pokémon has some similarities to a creature that an old book introduced as Slither Wing.
descriptionY: This Pokémon somewhat resembles an ancient form of Volcarona that was introduced in a dubious magazine.

name: Sandy Shocks
descriptionX: No records exist of this Pokémon being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon’s traits match up with a creature shown in an expedition journal.
descriptionY: It slightly resembles a Magneton that lived for 10,000 years and was featured in an article in a paranormal magazine.

name: Iron Treads
descriptionX: This Pokémon closely resembles a scientific weapon that a paranormal magazine claimed was sent to this planet by aliens.
descriptionY: Sightings of this Pokémon have occurred in recent years. It resembles a mysterious object described in an old expedition journal.

name: Iron Bundle
descriptionX: Its shape is similar to a robot featured in a paranormal magazine article. The robot was said to have been created by an ancient civilization.
descriptionY: It resembles a mysterious object mentioned in an old book. There are only two reported sightings of this Pokémon.

name: Iron Hands
descriptionX: It is very similar to a cyborg covered exclusively by a paranormal magazine. The cyborg was said to be the modified form of a certain athlete.
descriptionY: This Pokémon shares many similarities with Iron Hands, an object mentioned in a certain expedition journal.

name: Iron Jugulis
descriptionX: It resembles a certain Pokémon introduced in a paranormal magazine, described as the offspring of a Hydreigon that fell in love with a robot.
descriptionY: It’s possible that Iron Jugulis, an object described in an old book, may actually be this Pokémon.

name: Iron Moth
descriptionX: This Pokémon resembles an unknown object described in a paranormal magazine as a UFO sent to observe humanity.
descriptionY: No records exist of this species being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon’s traits match up with an object described in an old book.

name: Iron Thorns
descriptionX: It has some similarities to a Pokémon introduced in a dubious magazine as a Tyranitar from one billion years into the future.
descriptionY: Some of its notable features match those of an object named within a certain expedition journal as Iron Thorns.

name: Frigibax
descriptionX: Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.
descriptionY: This Pokémon lives in forests and craggy areas. Using the power of its dorsal fin, it cools the inside of its nest like a refrigerator.

name: Arctibax
descriptionX: Arctibax freezes the air around it, protecting its face with an ice mask and turning its dorsal fin into a blade of ice.
descriptionY: It attacks with the blade of its frozen dorsal fin by doing a front flip in the air. Arctibax’s strong back and legs allow it to pull off this technique.

name: Baxcalibur
descriptionX: This Pokémon blasts cryogenic air out from its mouth. This air can instantly freeze even liquid-hot lava.
descriptionY: It launches itself into battle by flipping upside down and spewing frigid air from its mouth. It finishes opponents off with its dorsal blade.

name: Chest Form Gimmighoul
descriptionX: This Pokémon was born inside a treasure chest about 1,500 years ago. It sucks the life-force out of scoundrels who try to steal the treasure.
descriptionY: It lives inside an old treasure chest. Sometimes it gets left in shop corners since no one realizes it’s actually a Pokémon.

name: Roaming Form Gimmighoul
descriptionX: This Pokémon was born from passion that seeped into a coin. It wanders, apparently seeking to return to the treasure chest it once inhabited.
descriptionY: It wanders around, carrying an old coin on its back. It survives by draining the life-force from humans who try to pick up its coin.

name: Gholdengo
descriptionX: Its body seems to be made up of 1,000 coins. This Pokémon gets along well with others and is quick to make friends with anybody.
descriptionY: It has a sturdy body made up of stacked coins. Gholdengo overwhelms its enemies by firing coin after coin at them in quick succession.

name: Wo-Chien
descriptionX: The grudge of a person punished for writing the king’s evil deeds upon wooden tablets has clad itself in dead leaves to become a Pokémon.
descriptionY: It drains the life-force from vegetation, causing nearby forests to instantly wither and fields to turn barren.

name: Chien-Pao
descriptionX: This Pokémon can control 100 tons of fallen snow. It plays around innocently by leaping in and out of avalanches it has caused.
descriptionY: The hatred of those who perished by the sword long ago has clad itself in snow and become a Pokémon.

name: Ting-Lu
descriptionX: The fear poured into an ancient ritual vessel has clad itself in rocks and dirt to become a Pokémon.
descriptionY: It slowly brings its exceedingly heavy head down upon the ground, splitting the earth open with huge fissures that run over 160 feet deep.

name: Chi-Yu
descriptionX: It controls flames burning at over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit. It casually swims through the sea of lava it creates by melting rock and sand.
descriptionY: The envy accumulated within curved beads that sparked multiple conflicts has clad itself in fire and become a Pokémon.

name: Roaring Moon
descriptionX: It is possible that this is the creature listed as Roaring Moon in an expedition journal that still holds many mysteries.
descriptionY: According to an article in a dubious magazine, this Pokémon has some connection to a phenomenon that occurs in a certain region.

name: Iron Valiant
descriptionX: It has some similarities to a mad scientist’s invention covered in a paranormal magazine.
descriptionY: It’s possible that this is the object listed as Iron Valiant in a certain expedition journal.

name: Koraidon
descriptionX: This seems to be the Winged King mentioned in an old expedition journal. It was said to have split the land with its bare fists.
descriptionY: This Pokémon resembles Cyclizar, but it is far burlier and more ferocious. Nothing is known about its ecology or other features.

name: Miraidon
descriptionX: Much remains unknown about this creature. It resembles Cyclizar, but it is far more ruthless and powerful.
descriptionY: This seems to be the Iron Serpent mentioned in an old book. The Iron Serpent is said to have turned the land to ash with its lightning.

name: Walking Wake
descriptionX: Ecology under research.
descriptionY: Ecology under research.

name: Iron Leaves
descriptionX: Ecology under analysis.
descriptionY: Ecology under analysis.
